column19: >Speereo Software UK Ltd. – private company founded in 1998. partners
column21: >Specialization – development of own proprietary speech recognition system
column22:
mobile and PC solutions based on Speereo Speech Recognition (SSR) Technology.

Offices – London head office and St.Petersburg, Russia – R&
column23:
D.
Main SSR development process took about three years and in year 2000 we have finalized our speaker independent speech recognition system with large vocabulary . 
At that time we were aiming at mobile and embedded devices that possessed small resources compared to PC market. Therefore we have strived to optimize SSR, to make it most effective in the market.
At the same time we have applied much effort in developing stable and high quality speech recognition that will bring same result in miscellaneous surroundings (in the street, moving vehicle, at the café, etc.).
In May of 2001 Speereo Speech interface was ported into Windows CE platform. By the end of 2001 Speereo Voice Organizer application was operating on HP Jornada 54X (SH3) and Casio Cassiopeia E-125 (MIPS). We were the first company that developed a working speech recognition engine for mobile market. 
In 2001 we have also started a development of multilanguage phrasebook application Speereo Voice Translator (SVT).
By spring of 2002 Speereo Voice Organizer was operating on Pocket PC devices and by August – nominated by PocketPC Magazine . Total number of Speereo SW users - more than 2 000 000. In June of 2005 first edition of Speereo Voice Translator (SVT) for Symbian was issued. Today SVT was updated several times and ported to Java platform as well.

Speereo Software has brought together over 30 years of speech recognition experience applied by our engineers, mathematicians, and programmers. Now the work on Speereo Speech Recognition Technology embodies 150 person-years. more...

column1: SnapQi is the world’s best and affordable gravity wireless charger designed for Android and iPhone. With the gravity auto clip tech, just place your phone in and it will hold it securely. With a charging conversion rate of over 80%, no need to worry about power down when you are navigating in your car.
Thanks for Jacob's review with iPhone X.
Thanks for Chris's review with Samsung S8 Plus.
Traditional way involves various middlemen standing in between the product and the customer. Now on Kickstarter, we delivery SnapQi directly on your hand.

By using a disruptive, direct-to-consumer model we cut out distributors, wholesalers and retails stores. This way, by avoiding all the middlemen we can offer you a three coils gravity car wireless charger for less than $20.

column2: >
column8: s=1c43e57ee9a410eef07e2a2e8a1925a1"" src=""""/>

column1: SnapQi supports International Qi fast wireless charging standard, simply place your phone in and it will start charging. You can get a wireless charging receiver if your phone doesn’t support wireless charging originally.
SnapQi fits different phone size perfectly with the auto clip design despite your phone is iPhone X(5.8 inches), Samsung S9(6.0 inches) or other bigger smartphones.

SnapQi capable to charge through the thickest case (Ottberbox Defender Series) without breaking a sweat. The enhanced coil transmitter allows the penetrating power delivering with an over 80% charging efficiency.
SnapQi supports iPhone X 7.5W fast wireless charging and Samsung 9W fast charging certificated and 10W fast charging for other Android devices. It will charge your phone with the maximum speed.
SnapQi comes with three coils to guarantee the best wireless charging experience. It will charge your phone perfectly no matter where your phone’s coil is.

column1: We are a small, tight-knit team made strong by our teammate who is experienced professionals in various fields. Although we have different backgrounds in design, engineering, and marketing, we all share one common goal: to innovate the way people charging.

We believe that the future is all wireless, the development path of the smartphone have proved that. In the future, our smartphone will receive the power like we connect the WiFi now. Our team wants to contribute to this dream and bring people a better wireless charging experience is the first step.

Any project could encounter unexpected obstacles, and this possibility is even more likely in the case of a hardware technology project that requires manufacturing. Keeping this in mind, we have already started to tackle some of these obstacles early on in order to minimize any delays.

1. The first potential problem is the production process has not been tested. We have prepared for that. The small batch production testing has been finished and we have sent 50 units sample for review. Every unit of SnapQi's functions and quality has been tested. The complete production process has been tested and we are going to start the mold design and prepare for mass production.

2. A second potential problem is the ability of manufacturer. Don't worry, we have contacted two experienced manufacturers to ensure the quantity of SnapQi. They all have many years of experience in the field of wireless charging product production and one of them is the Qi wireless charging board supplier of Belkin.

We are fully aware that unexpected bumps in the road may arise, but our team is dedicated to doing whatever it takes to keep our promises. We will update you on our progress and can’t wait to hear feedback from our backers in order to deliver the best SnapQi possible.

The Concept

We've created a solution for this everyday nuisance.  We've spent months collaborating with some of the smartest minds in Silicon Valley, and can now fully realize this amazing idea with your support.

 

EASY INSTALLATION

Redlight Greenlight has a spring-loaded arm to conveniently wedge the camera between your dashboard and windshield -- No suction cup or adhesive sticker necessary! Once in place, just download the Redlight Greenlight app, connect to its bluetooth, and you’re ready to drive smarter! The accessory has been designed to be as small and compact as possible for the least intrusive and most comfortable driving experience.

 

HIGH SENSITIVITY SENSOR

Redlight Greenlight is equipped with a CMOS image sensor. The device has undergone meticulous testing, including several rounds of beta trials. Even in low-light settings and extreme weather environments, Redlight Greenlight has been demonstrated identify all stoplights and faces with 99.987% accuracy.

130° FIELD OF VIEW

Equipped with a high definition lens, Redlight Greenlight’s 130° field of view is greater than the periphery of the human eye. The lens will cover your windshield's entire line of sight, plus the adjacent driving lanes to watch for any potential pedestrians.

REAL TIME PUSH NOTIFICATIONS

With instantaneous ""greenlight"" push notifications, you can maximize your time without ever missing another light. We understand how scary it is to be honked at, and our engineers have ensured that this frightening experience will be a thing of the past.

column7:
>Many of us treat our MackBooks and iPads better than, well, some of our ""good"" friends.  It's pretty safe to say we're kind of obsessed with them.  In a healthy, loving way, of course.

So, you'll

column1: to keep our own dedicated little babies safe, clean and looking new, over the past
couple of years we've created something we think you'll feel pretty good

It doesn't take long.  The first time your screen makes contact with your keyboard when your MacBook is closed, it will leave permanent scratches.  Happens on iPads with keyboard covers, too. And it just gets worse.

Just. Like. This:
column3:
/>

We knew this was a problem, because we all had it.  But then we found countless complaints from people who were flipping out over even recently purchased notebooks that started showing ""weird little marks"" on their pristine screens!  Not a design flaw, but a result of our penchant for thin, thin, thin, this same, nasty problem had been going on for years.

column1: From MacRumors Forums: ""Does anyone else have the problem with their MBA having hairline scratches on the screen from contact with the keyboard or trackpad? I didn't realize this was happening on my 13"" until I tried to clean it and noticed there are small dot scratches running in a line all the way across the screen. It lines up perfectly with the space bar and the metal dip under the keyboard before it meets the trackpad.""

From MacForums: ""Just something interesting that happened to me last night: I was eating potato chips whilst working on my MBP, and a 1-mm crumb landed on the wrist rest area. I didn't noticed and I closed the lappy when I turned in. This morn, when I opened it I noticed an itty-bitty dark spot on the screen which left a smudge when I swiped off with my finger. Knowing that my fingers weren't particularly greasy at the time, I wondered. I took a hanky and cleaned the smudge, and then I noticed the potato crumb in the afore mentioned area.

Moral of the story: just keep your machine always as clean as possible (especially the keyboard area), as sometimes it's debris the cause of screen scratches more than it's the keys.""

From Apple Support Forums: ""I have the Macbook Pro Retina 15"" and have experienced the same ""dust damage "" to my screen. Originally told i must have closed it with grit on the trackpad ! I take good care of all of my equipment as at £2000+ i cannot afford not to!""

Some twisted comfort in knowing it's a universal problem, yes, but we had a solution ready to go!

ELEGANT, EFFECTIVE PROTECTION. NOTHING BETTER.

Scudo is
from a Latin word meaning shield.
After all the research on the most effective material, and all the testing, cutting, fitting and testing again,
we've come up with the absolute best way to protect your notebook screens and

keyboards and keep them looking new for a very, very long time.

While we all agree cases, slips and covers are really good ideas, nobody's taken this part of protection seriously until now.

Made from genuine Ultrasuede®, Scudo naturally stays put between your keyboard and screen when you're traveling or about town.  It's an effective cushion, keeping the two from casually - and sometimes not so casually - making unauthorized contact.

Without Scudo, that means keys-meet-screen and leave increasingly ugly and permanent marks in commemoration.  Not a good look.  And, as a delightful bonus, Scudo keeps the natural skin oils that build up on keys from touching the screen, and even provides a bit of shock absorption.  All the while looking rather fetching, right?

column7: >The magic of Ultrasuede® begins with ultra-microfibers so fine they can't be seen by the naked eye: so minute a single pound could be stretched from the earth to the moon - and back!  Sheesh.

column1: best kind of paradox.  It's tough and
durable, while it's also very light, soft and beautiful.  It won't tear, fray or ball-up, is very
colorfast and is easily hand or machine washed.
But it looks and feels just like a very fine suede.  And it's a responsibly engineered, uniquely
molded fabric that is 100% recyclable.  There is nothing better.

when it's time to sell, you will always get more for it if it's clean and in
good condition.  Always.  This, alone, could save you a couple hundred
dollars.  And using Scudo daily will keep

crud from accumulating on - and in - the keyboard.  Another potentially big cost saver, and it slows down the whole life cycle thing.  The longer your notebook is in service, the less energy is used to recycle or (gasp!) find it's way into landfill.
obsessions go deep.  And although we all have long histories in varied businesses, we all like to keep our
shiny stuff shiny.  Knowing what it takes to make something right, we did a ton of real-world testing to find
just the right material, just the right weight and just the right shape. We've also spent a lot of time on details like
the best corner radii and selecting rich, vibrant colors that will make you
feel rather good every time you open your notebook.
could (not!) cut each one out with a sharp pair of scissors every time we got

many we produce, each one needs to be exactly the same, perfect size.  That requires uniquely-sized, precision-made cutting
dies, industrial machines that work tirelessly and with total precision, and
all the other stuff required that turns an idea into a company, and a product
we are asking for support.  To make Scudo
a perfect-every-time, made-from-the best-stuff, highly-reproducible product, it

sound packaging.  The $25,000 we are asking for will buy the initial production inventory
in at least six colors, buy tools, precision-manufacture Scudos, and package them for mailing to you.

>Stretch goal #3:  $75,000, we can add the above, plus a whole new product, an iPhone Ultrasuede slip in at least six colors (pics coming).

column1: support now will help create the foundation of a conscious brand we can all get behind.  It's critically important to us to build a true triple-bottom-line company that makes products we feel great about using, from
their undeniable functionality, to their simple beauty, to their reverence for
people and the environment.  We already have
more obsessive-grade quality Scudo products in the pipeline you'll be the first
to know about, and get early deals on!
PLEASE TALK TO US ALONG THE WAY

to give back from the very beginning, a portion of all our profits will go to
supporting social causes and community activities.
hesitate to contact us with questions or ideas.  We want Scudo to be the best possible
protection for your beloved shiny objects.

Stretch goal #3:  $75,000, we can add the above, plus a whole new product, an iPhone Ultrasuede slip in at least six colors (pics coming).

cardZcase is a patented sleek iphone 4/4S premium quality case for discreetly storing a credit card or working contactless/NFC/RFID payment, travel or work ID card. It adds just 1mm to the thickness profile of the iphone. It is easy to detach and use the consealed card conventionally in an ATM or with Chip and Pin. But a smart card co-located with the iphone within the case effectively give you Contactless payment on your exisiting iphone!

The cardZcase team is based in Cambridge in the UK. Mark is our front man and artist. Pascal is the one with lots of previous internet sales experience. We also have the support of our friends and colleagues who have invested both time and money to get us to this point.

We believe the world should be a place where good innovations flourish - whether they come from a billion dollar multinational corporation or a tiny start-up like ours.  And we ask for your support for cardZcase to prove it.

I'm sure many of you are like us and have forgetten your wallet or your ID card. Quite frustating isn't it? but surprisingly not many of us forget our smartphones thesedays. Thinking about these issues we came up with idea of attaching the credit card or ID card to the smartphone.

But to keep things safe the card needed to be discreetly attached yet easlity accessibly. We started in June 2011 and after much thought and many design versions later we ultimately came up with this simple yet elegant design which (surprise, surprise) we've called 'cardZcase' - your card and your iphone - 'secretly together' in an british designed case which only adds 1mm to the profile of the iphone.The current CardZcase will fit the iphone 4/4S, both the black and white versions.

This card also gives exisiting iphone 4/4S users the ability to use Contactless payments in thousands of establishments with their existing contactless card. A surprisingly low tech solution to the future of mobile payments - No apps to download and install, no service to sign up to, no complicated setting - Just put in your exisiting contactless card in the case and off you go.

It looks, feels and behaves like the iphone has integrated contactless payment. Every vendor who has seen us use the case is always amazed how we were able to add contactless functionality to an iphone!

Millions of people already have contactless cards in their wallets without knowing it. Use the contactless feature by simply swiping the phone on the payment terminal. If you don't have contactless then you can always use the card as a conventional card by removing it and easily replacing it back.

<div>Clearly all NFC/RFID cards which are shaped like a credit card (ID-1 specification to be exact) can fit into the case. This makes it rather handy to use with many public transport smart cards. No more fiddling to get the card out of your wallet. We've extensively tested the card on London's OYSTER underground system and it works like a charm. It will similarly work on many other smart transport cards - pity though we haven't got around to travelling the world to test them - perhaps a future indiegogo project

For many of us, our work ID cards are not only our photo identification, they are also our keyless entry into work. They control access into car parks, office buildings and adjacent areas. ID-1 or credit card size IDs fit snugly into cardZcase and work seamlessly to allow your iphone to give you access. You may never be able to use the excuse of the misplaced work access card again to come late to work!

The cases will be sourced from our British based partners. They have over a decade of experience in case manufacture and they make cases for Ted Baker, Quiksilver etc and are part of supply chain for even the likes of Bentley. So though we may be a start-up the quality of the product will be at the top end of the range.

Though we have produced white and black prototypes, the first production cases will be be of much better build quality that the ones you can see in our pictures. We've chosen to go with the black case which will be pretty much the same as the ones on the pictures except for a small cardZcase logo on the external surface of the case.

We've spend hundreds of hours and thousands of dollars designing, patenting and prototyping this case. There are 4 patents granted and registrations in 25 countries are already in place. These have taken a long time to put into place with a steep learning curve for our team but with intellectual property protection in place, we are the only people in the world who can provide you with this exclusive design feature!

We need your support to provide us the money to get manufacturing off the ground for the final leg of this long journey.  In return we offer you the chance to be the first to own these cases as soon as they come off the production line. You will literally be the first in the world to own these babies!!

The first 50 to support us with $10s get a black cardZcase as a special thank you. We also thank subsequent pledges of support for $15 (first 100) and $20 with the chance to be amongst the first worldwide to have these cardZcases. There are greater incentives for larger donations.
So what does the $14,000 get us? We'll here what we hope your support will get us:
1) indiegogo and credit card/paypal transaction charges (7 percent)
2) Cost of final pre-production design modifications
3) Production of Tools for case manufacture
For each of the the hundreds of cases as part of the perks:
5) 'Soft touch' coating and design layered on each case

After we have posted off all the perks, We estimate we will have some samples left for us to show to traditional sales outlets to encourage them to start selling these cases and get a conventional business off the ground.
After the close of fundraising on indiegogo, there a short delay before we get the money. After that we hope to start posting out the perks in 4 weeks.

If we meet out funding goal, all of you will have shown that there is a demand for cardZcase and a future in investing in further production. We hope to form a viable small interprise that will ultimately provide employment locally and contribute to the economy. Hopefully the future holds lots of different cardZcase designs for the iphone and similar ones for other smartphones as well.
WE VALUE YOUR SUPPORT - IN ALL ITS FORMS

I hope you have belief in our product - we do! For those willing to support us at the earliest stage we have some great incentives.  Even if you're not in the market for a unique functional high quality iphone case, please consider helping in the following ways:
• Spread the word to friends or family - Share buttons just below video above.
• Consider a small donation of $5 to the cause.
• Tweet or post about us (links below) #cardZcase
• Complete the online survey on http://twrmv.cjb.net/

Though we have extensively tested smart card use in the cardZcase, we cannot guarantee that it will work in all the situations a smart card may possibly be used from within the case.

Bringing the Power to the People:

At the Elevated Technologies family, we have a lot of engineers that love the tech devices. We have a lot of battery packs lying around. We have a lot of different battery packs for different uses. But that is the problem, we have a lot of types of battery packs to suit different needs. We got tired of finding which battery pack worked with what device, had the right power outputs, battery capacity, etc... We set out to fix that problem with the Next Generation Fusion Pack. The Next Generation Fusion Pack smashes through the barriers and offers the versatility to really power your world of device with one battery pack and expand the battery capacity as needed to for longer uses (see the linked Next Generation feature).

This has been quite the journey for us. We stumbled along the way (as you saw above). However with lots of support from everyone and with a lot of hard work from our Elevated Technologies family we feel that the Fusion Pack is better for it. Take a look at what puts the Fusion Pack in a class of its own.

Fusion Pack Specs:

What makes the Next Generation Linkable Fusion Pack Different:


1.) Linkable Fusion Packs (Video to come shortly):

column1: • The most exciting thing about the next generation Fusion Pack is the ability to link multiple Fusion Packs together to increase the battery capacity. While one Fusion Pack has 24000mah, when you use the linkage tool to connect the two Fusion Packs together, and you now have 48000mah of power to continue to charge you devices for double the time. Unlike with other battery packs don't have to unplug or switch the wiring with linked Fusion Packs. Now you can link two Fusion Packs together and keep your device running for twice the time.

<li>We have redesign the power management system of the Next Generation Fusion Pack so when you plug in the wall charge it charges like normal, but when you plug in the linking adapter the Battery Packs are linked together so you can have double the battery capacity &amp

• Imagine watching the entire Lord of the Rings Trilogy (extended edition of course!) on your flight from California to South Africa without ever having to have your laptop plugged in or swapping batteries!
• Running your home office (e.g. your laptop, wireless router, and smartphone) through a multi-day power outage.

• Or if there is a natural disaster and your are without power (such as lights or heat). With the linked Fusion Packs you can have some light and run a small heater (using the cigarette lighter adapter) for a few days till the power comes back on.

Here is a picture of the Linked Fusion Packs

How does Fusion Pack linking work?

The non-techie answer: With the linking adapter you simply connect the two fusion packs together and are able to add 24000mAh to the battery capacity of the Linked Fusion Pack. For example link 2 Fusion Packs together you get 48000mAh of capacity, 3 linked together means  72000mAh, and so forth

The techie answer: We designed the power management system to be able to link the Fusion Packs together in series. That means that the the Fusion Packs will drain sequentially (you'll use up the battery of the first Fusion Pack and then the second Fusion Pack).

Why would you link the Fusion Packs?

  • Link the Fusion Packs together lets you have continuous power for longer periods of time. So you can set up your Linked Fusion Packs and not have to worry about switching between power supplies when one runs out. This allows you to supply power to your devices for longer periods of time without worrying about the power running out (unlike other battery packs where you would have to be constantly watching the power level of each battery pack to know when to switch the battery pack). 

Other Cool Features of the Linkable Next Generation Fusion Pack:

2.) Charge 3 different types of devices at the same time! (16/19V, 12V, and USB all at the same time)

  • Each Fusion Pack has 3 Different types of outputs: You can charge at 3 different voltages at the same time (USB, 12V, and 16-19V)

column2: >This case is durable. It can with-stand just about anything you throw at it and won't get scratched. The aluminum we will use is a harden sandblasted aluminum that won't get scratched up.

column1: • Component Design: Unlike cheap designs or ones that break after a few uses. The next generation Fusion Pack is designed to outlast the devices it charges.
• Case Design: Inspired by the sleek Ultra-books, we designed the next generation Fusion Pack to have a slim design while sitting nicely on a desk, table, or airplane tray.

column2:
>5.) Cigarette Lighter Device Connector:
  • If you are like us you have a lot of adapters for your car to charge your devices. Now you can use those same car adapters with next generation Fusion Pack no matter where you are.

Why we need your help:

The Utah CNC shop was a great aid in helping us create a nice looking next generation prototype Fusion Pack. We are now polishing the next generation Fusion Pack with a few final tweaks. However, the CNC shop will not be able to help us take the next generation Fusion Pack to full manufacturing. Manufacturing can be costly and we need $40,000 to get the tooling all set up and do a first run of the next generation Fusion Pack. With your help we can get tooling set up and get the prototype of next generation fusion pack to manufacturing. Please support us and help us make the world truly powerful with fusion.

We Want You to Join the Elevated Power Family:

Please pledge your support to our campaign. Whether it is $5 or $500 we appreciate your help in bringing our prototype to life.

Meet The Management Team:


The Elevated Technologies family is comprised of a vast array of experience in the technology field. We have several experienced electrical engineers on the team. The Elevated Technologies family also has a couple people to counter-balance the nerdy engineers.

Devin W. Miller, Co-Founder &
column5:
CEO:


- Devin received a B.S. in both Electrical Engineering and Mandarin Chinese from Brigham Young University, and J.D. and M.B.A. degrees from Case Western Reserve University. Devin is a full time patent attorney and full time entrepreneur. He founded Elevated Technologies with his wife who both have a love for electronics and innovatation. Devin was the originator of the Personalized Power concept. Devin is a techie at heart and loves to wear board shorts and flip-flops when he can get away with it.

Brooke Miller, Co-Founder &
column7:
Sales:


- Brooke is a full time mother and supporter of her husband's ventures. She has experience in order fulfillment, marketing, and sales. She is responsible for product promotion &
column8:
marketing as well as making sure everything gets shipped out on time. She was the director of the great promotional/introductory video, drafting of the product information, and will coordinate the video hangouts. She will also be working to find a manufacturer and ensuring that they maintain the same quality and efficiency as our prototypes.

David R. Miller, Chief Technology Officer &
column9:
Vice President of Development:

- David received a B.S. in Electrical Engineering and a M.S. in Physics from Brigham Young University. David has previously served as Director of Medical Device Research and Development for a Fortune 500 company, along with being the Chief Technology Officer and Vice President of Research and Development for several scientific and medical technology companies. He founded DRMiller Engineering in 2008 to provide engineering consulting for small to large employers worldwide. With over 30 years of experience in electrical engineering, he has expertise in high frequency electromagnetics and electrical and mechanical instrumentation.

Miller, Co-Founder & CEO:- Devin received a B.S. in both Electrical Engineering and Mandarin Chinese from Brigham Young University, and J.D. and M.B.A. degrees from Case Western Reserve University. Devin is a full time patent attorney and full time entrepreneur. He founded Elevated Technologies with his wife who both have a love for electronics and innovatation. Devin was the originator of the Personalized Power concept. Devin is a techie at heart and loves to wear board shorts and flip-flops when he can get away with it.Brooke Miller, Co-Founder & Vice President of Marketing & Sales:- Brooke is a full time mother and supporter of her husband's ventures. She has experience in order fulfillment, marketing, and sales. She is responsible for product promotion & marketing as well as making sure everything gets shipped out on time. She was the director of the great promotional/introductory video, drafting of the product information, and will coordinate the video hangouts. She will also be working to find a manufacturer and ensuring that they maintain the same quality and efficiency as our prototypes.David R. Miller, Chief Technology Officer & Vice President of Development:- David received a B.S. in Electrical Engineering and a M.S. in Physics from Brigham Young University. David has previously served as Director of Medical Device Research and Development for a Fortune 500 company, along with being the Chief Technology Officer and Vice President of Research and Development for several scientific and medical technology companies. He founded DRMiller Engineering in 2008 to provide engineering consulting for small to large employers worldwide. With over 30 years of experience in electrical engineering, he has expertise in high frequency electromagnetics and electrical and mechanical instrumentation.",14.0,1,"4 Campaigns

Hidden Camera Detector for iPhone and Android. Help make sure there are no spy cameras invading your privacy.

Help bring our popular iOS Hidden Camera Detector app to Android

The Hidden Camera Detector App is already a success for iOS at the App Store with thousands of downloads and 60,000 Facebook likes and counting!

Due to overwhelming requests we are funding the “final” development for Android.
column4:

The Android version is already 80% done so we expect we can release it to you in February, but no later than March. Great products are only half the battle, we need marketing dollars to let people know there is an inexpensive way to protect them from spying eyes. Also, as with many utilities, we need to keep developing training materials about how to use the app and get more high ratings coming in.

column5: >y has created cameras small enough that they can be placed in almost anything. These cameras are found in clocks, pens, key-chain remotes, watches, teddy bears, sunglasses, computer speakers, air conditioners and even your bathrobe hook!
column6:
/>

According to thelaw.tv in a recent article, quote:

""Hidden cameras are often be used for more sinister purposes than security or entertainment. If you search the web for hidden camera footage, you’ll find many unsavory images of people who were filmed without being aware of it.""

Can you see the camera in the bathrobe hook above?

http://www.fox19.com/story/22683471/man-accused-of-planting-camera-at-starbucks-in-custody

How do I use the HCD app?

Open the app, point your phones camera at a suspicious object or at part of the room to be scanned, (ideally at 2-4 feet) then press the search button. Hold the camera still for a few seconds while the detector analyzes the area or until you begin to see red cross-hairs appear. If no cross-hairs appear point your camera at another part of the room and begin again until you have scanned all parts of the room.

column1:
Hotel shower, hidden camera story:

http://www.kxan.com/news/local/austin/austin-hotel-guest-finds-hidden-camera-in-shower

How does the HCD app find tiny cameras?

The HCD app uses your phones camera flash to create a reflection from the lens of any camera. In order for a spy camera to record your activities it must have an exposed lens and so the HCD app can find it.

The HCD apps video content analysis algorithm then goes into effect, comparing reflections shown on your video screen to known hidden camera identifiers.

If you see a steady red cross-hair on the screen this is a target you should visually inspect for telltale signs that it may be a spy camera.
column4:
/>

How do I know if I found a hidden spy camera?

Look for a small lens about the size of the head of a pin. Also look for wires or small antennae connected to the device. However, many spy cameras are self contained camera and recorders requiring no wires or antennae and may be embedded into devices like clocks, pens or key-chain remotes. In this case you should look for a USB connection port or SD memory card slot, these are required to transfer the spy video to a computer.


Key-chain remote spy camera with built in DVR
column16: >GET AN AWESOME RADIO FREQUENCY BUG DETECTOR HARDWARE SPY CAMERA FINDER!!
column17:
>

How can I learn to tell what targets are cameras?

Practice on traditional, indoor security cameras, its fun and will help you understand what a high probability target looks like.

What if I find a spy camera?

If you think you found a real spy camera you can click the camera button while scanning in the HCD app.

If you enabled location tracking this will save an image of the camera and its GPS location to support any claim of invasion of privacy you might pursue.

You can also click the folder icon in the HCD app and email us the image for a second opinion forensics@hcdapp.com Take a few pictures to increase your odds of getting a good image.
column18:
/>

Do you provide free updates?

Yes, the software algorithm required to detect tiny cameras is very complex and we will be improving the algorithm though your input and machine learning techniques for many years to come. Be sure and update your HCD app often as new generations of the app can represent giant leaps in detection capability.

http://www.nbcdfw.com/news/local/Man-Gets-Probation-for-Hiding-Camera-in-Rec-Center-Changing-Area-205392621.html

column2:
>What kind of objects might contain spy cameras?

Clocks, pens, key-chain remotes, watches, teddy bears, sunglasses, computer speakers, air conditioners and even your bathrobe and towel hook!

Watch the video and learn more about spy cameras at www.HCDapp.com

Where should I be concerned about finding hidden spy cameras?

Spy cameras have been found in corporate environments, offices, locker rooms, tanning booths, bedrooms, private residences, schools, retail locations, changing rooms, and many other locations where a person has a reasonable expectation of privacy.

Thank you for your help and happy spy camera hunting!!!

REALLY IMPORTANT NOTES: Your iOS or Android device must have an on-board Torch or Flash for the app to work. Otherwise, you can use the app with a bright LED of flashlight. using an additional light can also increase the range that the app can detect cameras. The Android app will work optimally at 2-4 feet for pinhole lenses, although you can still practice at greater distance with standard security cameras. This is a utility or tool, not a game or simulation, please see the instructional videos before you buy or use the app.

All products subject to the terms and conditions set forth in the website and EULA, see www.hcdapp.com for more details.

column1:
Our team has many years of software development experience from patent filings, product road-map, beta version releases and bug fixes. Many of the challenges when releasing a new app have already been addressed. Customer ratings, proper instructional videos and bug fixes have all been experienced with the iOS app. However, additional challenges lay ahead as we tackle a new hardware platform and a much larger user group of Android devices. We fully expect that version 1.0 will face both appreciative and critical review, need for incremental improvement and down the road, competitive pressures. Our proven model of frankly addressing customer input, releasing improved versions and filing for IP protections is exactly how we plan to address the challenges ahead.

Perhaps our biggest challenge is user education. Even though we have published detailed instructions and videos about how to use the app, and most users recognize this is a tool, not a game, we still get the occupational person who rates the app with something like ""I pointed the app at my glass of water, and it says there is a hidden camera in there""...

The app looks for lens flare or reflection from hidden pinhole camera lenses, and there will be false targets, particularly on reflective surfaces. The app uses immensely complex video content analysis and mathematical algorithms. Instructions for use are all covered in our videos. The app points the user in the right direction, you have to look at high probability targets and determine if they are in fact cameras or false targets. Our thousands of users have found many cameras and protected their privacy from predators, but if you know someone who thinks their glass of water is a spy camera, please don't let them buy the app, it makes keeping the ratings up a challenge :)

column25:
>Why we need You

Ever since we began mobile application development, our primary motive is to add value to people’s life with their little budget. We believe that your support SLIMMY power bank will break it into the market at a low cost for the benefits the populace. We at this moment solicit for your support to bring this beautiful dream into reality. We need your financial empowerment for complete the production of the Second phase and finish testing and assembling final product.  Remember with SLIMMY power bank, you can rely on your phone.
column27:
>Other ways you can help

Apart from your financial support, there are other ways you could help us spread the news about SLIMMY. We kindly request that you help us share our campaign page on all your social media platforms. E.g. Facebook, Twitter, and  Instagram. Our aim is to let the whole world know that a new ultra slim power bank will soon be out in the market. We appreciate all your contributions so far. Your comments, financial supports, advice, and criticism have made us gone this far. We collectively say THANK YOU!
column30:
>FAQ:

 1. How to charge power bank?

We provide USB usb extension cord for charging SLIMMY from Laptop but You can use normal smartphone charger to charge Your SLIMMY too.

 2. How do I know if battery bank is charging?

When charging the power bank, the red light shines. It will take about 2.5 hours to charge it full. And the light will shut oﬀ after the power bank is fully charged.

3. How do I know if my smartphone is charging?

. When charging your iPhone or Android phone, the blue light shines. It will shut oﬀ after your smartphone is fully charged or the electricity of the power bank has been used out.

4. How much I can charge my phone?

. This power bank can charge 35% for iphone7, 6 plus and 6s plus, 50% for iphone 6 and 6s, 70% for iphone 5 and 5s. It is your best choice for emergency use.

5. How strong is a power bank?

. This power bank is made of 304 stainless steel. So SLIMMY super durable, safe and convenient to use. 

6. How long time I need to charge my phone?

It can take minimum 20 minutes up to 1 hr to use all charge energy from battery bank. All depend on how you are using your phone during charging and what is a model of your phone. .When it is charging for your smartphone, it is in super fast charging status. So you still can use your phone during charging even your phone in 1% battery charging limit.

7. Is it support both iPhone and Android phones?

Yes, When you Back it you will be asked to choose which connection you want, iPhone or Android. But still you will get adapter in case you will need to charge another smartphone.

Flash,USB2UART chip,it provides many interfaces such as 10/100M

(33 X 27 mm), the interface spacing is 2.0mm,and the USB interface is used for a
USB2UART debug port and power supply,so,Just need an ordinary USB cable,we can
RobinCam can be docked with robincore, there is a HD CMOS sensor OV9712 and a wide-angle lens on the top of RobinCam.
On the RobinMac,there is a 10/100 Ethernet circuit,microphone and  a SD card (bottom).

Sad2Happy app is a social media app with the focus on certain people dealing with a sad episode on their life, they will be able to make friends with people dealing with the same situation, in other words, to help those people who are going through a sad episode in their life to interact and connect with other people who may be in the same situation so in that way they can freely have a conversation about their problems, become friends, create a group, share ideas and meet.

Our vision is to help two or more people who may be in the same situation or having the same problem to get connected, interact, have a conversation about their problems, meet and make friends. By doing that, those people who are in a state of loneliness, sadness or even depression, will get their need and the urge to talk to someone who may have gone through the same situation and talk about their problems, fulfilled.

 

             The main reason behind it, is that even when someone who feels sad, feel lonely or even get to the point to have depression have these feelings and urge to talk to someone, a person who can understand them, or at least to hear what their problems are about, because even if a person who is going through a sad episode in their and say they just want to be alone or that they don't wish to talk to anyone, they don't really mean it, the reason is because of what the other person is going to think about them.

 

              The reality is that they don't go out and just want to be inside their homes alone but, one thing we have to take into account, is that thanks to the rapid advancement of the technology and the ability to connect to people without going out, when they are alone, they always would have their smartphones with them and that they go through apps looking at funny videos to feel better but, they make a comment in the comment section expressing their feeling with hope that maybe someone may comment back with positive massage like: “i know how you feel”, “i hope you feel better” or “ is there a way we could connect so maybe to can tell me what wrong?”. So these are the main points the Sad2Happy app wants to cover and to focus more on people who are going through a sad episode in their life to connect with more people or even specialists who can understand their feelings because they feel the same way, make new friends and create a better social life.

The Sad2Happy app will help lower the rates and percentages of people dealing with sadness, loneliness or even depression, by creating a network among users who can talk to each other about their situation they are in or the problem they are dealing with.

It's Functionality

 

                                   The app will have the ability to do the following:

 

1)The user will be able to create their own profiles.
2)Looking up someone to talk to by using a Hashtag (#) ex: #sad as result, there will be a list of users looking up the same hashtag.
3)The user will have the option to send a brief message, add as a friend and see previous status updates, based on their privacy settings.
4)The user will be able to update status, with the ability to change its privacy settings
5)The app will have a settings button where the user will be able to find the following options
column2: Account settings, friends, and the Help button and more.

column1: 6)It will also include the User agreement section so the user can review it.

The users will benefit from the use of this app by decreasing their sad episode in their life, having many options on the app, having the opportunity to talk to other people about their problems or their situation, because all they want is some to talk to, and also making friends.

Our vision and goal

 

From the moment people start using the Sad2Happy app, to 5 years, we expect big changes by decreasing the rates of people dealing with sadness, loneliness or even depression, because the user will finally be connected on a social media that is more focused to their situation and feelings, and may even work better than the other regular apps that exist out there who don't  have the focus on their situation, so we are giving our users that opportunity

 

Our goal is to change the worldwide rates and percentages of people dealing with a sad episode in their life and to lower the percentages of people diagnosed with major depression.

 

What makes our social media app different than others?, Is that we are more focused on people’s feelings, on connecting people who feel lonely, creating real-life friendships between people who can understand each other, we have the goal to lower the worldwide reports of people dealing with depression and with possibility to also lower the suicide rates within only 5 years.

Sad2Happy app is a social media app with the focus on certain people dealing with a sad episode on their life, they will be able to make friends with people dealing with the same situation, in other words, to help those people who are going through a sad episode in their life to interact and connect with other people who may be in the same situation so in that way they can freely have a conversation about their problems, become friends, create a group, share ideas and meet.

Our vision is to help two or more people who may be in the same situation or having the same problem to get connected, interact, have a conversation about their problems, meet and make friends. By doing that, those people who are in a state of loneliness, sadness or even depression, will get their need and the urge to talk to someone who may have gone through the same situation and talk about their problems, fulfilled.              The main reason behind it, is that even when someone who feels sad, feel lonely or even get to the point to have depression have these feelings and urge to talk to someone, a person who can understand them, or at least to hear what their problems are about, because even if a person who is going through a sad episode in their and say they just want to be alone or that they don't wish to talk to anyone, they don't really mean it, the reason is because of what the other person is going to think about them.               The reality is that they don't go out and just want to be inside their homes alone but, one thing we have to take into account, is that thanks to the rapid advancement of the technology and the ability to connect to people without going out, when they are alone, they always would have their smartphones with them and that they go through apps looking at funny videos to feel better but, they make a comment in the comment section expressing their feeling with hope that maybe someone may comment back with positive massage like: “i know how you feel”, “i hope you feel better” or “ is there a way we could connect so maybe to can tell me what wrong?”. So these are the main points the Sad2Happy app wants to cover and to focus more on people who are going through a sad episode in their life to connect with more people or even specialists who can understand their feelings because they feel the same way, make new friends and create a better social life.

The Sad2Happy app will help lower the rates and percentages of people dealing with sadness, loneliness or even depression, by creating a network among users who can talk to each other about their situation they are in or the problem they are dealing with.
It's Functionality                                    The app will have the ability to do the following: 1)The user will be able to create their own profiles.
2)Looking up someone to talk to by using a Hashtag (#) ex: #sad as result, there will be a list of users looking up the same hashtag.
3)The user will have the option to send a brief message, add as a friend and see previous status updates, based on their privacy settings.
4)The user will be able to update status, with the ability to change its privacy settings
5)The app will have a settings button where the user will be able to find the following options
column2: Account settings, friends, and the Help button and more.

column1: 6)It will also include the User agreement section so the user can review it.

The users will benefit from the use of this app by decreasing their sad episode in their life, having many options on the app, having the opportunity to talk to other people about their problems or their situation, because all they want is some to talk to, and also making friends.

Our vision and goal From the moment people start using the Sad2Happy app, to 5 years, we expect big changes by decreasing the rates of people dealing with sadness, loneliness or even depression, because the user will finally be connected on a social media that is more focused to their situation and feelings, and may even work better than the other regular apps that exist out there who don't  have the focus on their situation, so we are giving our users that opportunity Our goal is to change the worldwide rates and percentages of people dealing with a sad episode in their life and to lower the percentages of people diagnosed with major depression. What makes our social media app different than others?, Is that we are more focused on people’s feelings, on connecting people who feel lonely, creating real-life friendships between people who can understand each other, we have the goal to lower the worldwide reports of people dealing with depression and with possibility to also lower the suicide rates within only 5 years.

Distracted Driving Kills! Stay Safe with MindAlert™

This revolutionary 5-star* rated NEW phone App by Human Autonomous Solutions is the result of creating effective and valuable solutions assisting humanity through Artificial Intelligence!

The inventor and founder, a neuroscientist and engineer, lost his father due to a tragic auto accident because a driver fell asleep at the wheel a few years ago.  He took a vow to save lives and invent a product that could prevent this tragedy, that everyone could afford.  I am sure all of you, know someone who has been affected by this kind of horrific event.

<li>The National Highway Transportation Safety Association (NHTSA) estimates that drowsy and distracted driving were responsible for 72,000 crashes , 44,000 injuries, and 4,900 deaths in 2017 (NHTSA, 2018)

<li>However, these numbers are drastically underestimated and up to 6,000 fatal crashes – potential multiple deaths in each crash-- each year are caused by drowsy and distracted drivers according to the CDC (Nov 7, 2018)

We present you with MindAlert™ that is designed and engineered to help keep your mind alert while at work, in school, or driving.  Teaming your iPhone with your Apple Watch, the alarm will sound if you become distracted, task saturated, if you are daydreaming, or if you are getting sleepy. Patented technology has adjustable features and can alert you before you fall asleep. An alarm will sound if you become too fatigued or distracted to drive. MindAlert™ has adjustable features and can trigger an alarm with varying sensitivity, keeping you alert in a variety of situations. Self-learning through artificial intelligence improves performance over time and automatic updates ensure you have the latest and best-performing version.

MindAlert™ sounds an alarm when you are:

• Distracted

• Task Saturated

• Daydreaming

• Drowsy

Available at www.Mind-Alert.com and the Apple App Store

Funding is needed because we are a new high tech start-up company and we need it for creating and developing applications that save lives for people who are flying commercial aircraft and or for other modes of transportation.  Additionally, we need funding so that we can make it available for Fitbit users and Android and Galaxy customers.  

 

*as of 1 Dec 2019

 

 

“MindAlert” and “ImpairedAlert” phone apps are to be used as guides/aids only. They may not work for everyone and are not to be solely relied upon to stay awake, prevent getting a DUI or excuse illegal activity. They are not a replacement for sound judgment, getting a proper amount of rest and making safe choices. Do not drink and drive. Do not operate motor vehicles or heavy machinery under the influence of drugs, alcohol or medication, or drive while drowsy. Human Autonomous Solutions, LLC assumes no responsibility or liability for the use, misuse or inability to properly use their products. Your results may vary.

Imagine living without light. Or electricity. Or heat.
For those caught in the aftermath of a natural disaster, this is their reality.
Simple, basic comforts we take for granted – until they’re gone.
It could happen to anybody. Even you.
There is, however, a simple solution to providing basic survival tools for victims of a catastrophe who find themselves without power.
Introducing the tPOD Emergency Preparedness Kit (tPOD EPK)
Using a standard propane-isobutane-butane mixture canister, each tPOD EPK creates enough thermoelectric energy to be a personal power generator.
By making them available to emergency response teams, and individuals who want an extra sense of security, we can help people make it through difficult times.
We are asking for the support of the Indiegogo Crowd Funding Community to provide the start-up costs to cover our tooling expenses for the project.

column6: >

column3: >    Rendering of our complete tPOD Emergency Preparedness Kit (tPOD EPK)

column1: Each tPOD emergency preparedness generator kit provides enough electricity for a smartphone/GPS device, small cook stove and high efficiency, LED lighting.
Instead of feeling alone, scared or even helpless, having the ability to see at night, eat a warm meal or call a loved one gives people a sense of normalcy in times of distress.
Repairing a community’s infrastructure can take hours, days or even weeks. The tPOD EPK comes in a compact carrying case and is ready to go at any given moment.

column5: >

column2: >                                           Our tPOD EPK prototype in action
>Pledge today and be energy self-sufficient with your own tPOD EPK! For a pledge of $295 or $325 you can take charge of your personal power needs when faced with an emergency or power outage.

column6: >

column1: For a pledge of $175 or $195 you can own the  tPOD5.1 Base Kit.
Our tPOD5.1 Personal Power Generator puts you in control with Tellurex Power On Demand!

column5: >

column1: Rendering of tPOD5.1 Personal Power Generator

column3: >Our tPOD5.1 Personal Power Generator prototypes are fully functioning as seen in the demonstration video, and our renderings show the finished product appearance that we envision.

column1: The final product appearance may not be exactly as pictured in the designer's conceptual renderings and the demonstration video. The quality will be upheld—changes in the appearance may occur during the development and launch of the project.
There is a possible time delay due to receiving the certifications for certain components
column2: namely, the high efficiency voltage regulation circuitry developed for the tPOD5.1 Personal Power Generator as well as the certifications needed for the tPOD Portable Cook Stove. The certification testing is not expected to uncover any issues.
>
column3: >Our ability to deliver has been proven by our successful launch of the tPOD1. We are ready, able and excited to provide this essential tool for the safety &amp
column4: enjoyment of our Indiegogo community and the world at large.

column1: Thank you for considering backing our project!

The Juicer is a dual sided charging device that allows you to transfer battery power from one Android to another. It's the most convenient way for you to charge your phone when there isn't an outlet around. 

We found the market was filled with pricey charger cases and external power packs that were bulky and tough to carry around. We saw an opportunity to create something slim, an accessory that could go where you and other Android users go. Think of the Juicer as jumper cables for your keychain.
column46:
>

Our phones can always use a charge. But there isn’t always a free outlet nearby, or a charger handy. Sometimes all we just need is a quick 5 or 10% to make a call or send a few texts. But what if our friends could be the lifeline to give us the power we need to send a text or make a call?
column50: >The Juicer is first to market in the United States and we’re proud to debut the product after two years of product design, re-tooling and testing. It’s the world’s smallest, thinnest and lightest phone-to-phone charger, fitting conveniently on a keyring or inside a purse.

column1: Ways to Share the Power: How it Works
You can also share the power from your own tablet.
Charges at the same speed as if you were plugged into the USB port of your computer.
Watch as our Lead Engineer Konstantin demonstrates how to use the Juicer.
Watch our engineer Konstantin Advaschenko describe the science behind the Juicer.

We’re makers who happen to be advertising creatives. We're passionate innovators who are always creating new products, services and apps. The Juicer was developed by Phone, Wallet, Keys Inc., a NYC based startup company. The company was founded by Nick Hugh Schmidt and David Ma.

The idea for the Juicer came along when David and Nick were out to brunch one day. David’s phone was nearly dead, while Nick had a good 80%. A few mimosas and bloody mary’s later, the idea for the Juicer was scribbled on a napkin. They began testing prototypes that same week, building a team to make their idea come to life.

From San Francisco, CA. David went to Syracuse University and works as a copywriter at a NYC advertising agency. He lives in Manhattan where he continues to tinker with new innovations, write ads and work as a food stylist in his free time.
Born in Cleveland Ohio. Received his bachelors in fine art at Columbus College of Art and Design. Currently resides in Brooklyn where he continues to pursue creative endeavors.

Manny is currently a Content Manager at an advertising agency. As a champion for the end user, he is constantly probing to understand why people believe, think, and behave the way they do, while simultaneously searching for ways brands can offer experiences that not only push the boundaries of technology, but are born of genuine consumer need. Operating from this background in strategy with a human-first approach, he now concepts/oversees emerging initiatives at the intersection of brand storytelling, content marketing and remix culture.

Allen Shieh 

Allen Shieh is the CEO and Co-Founder of MakeSimply, a sourcing and manufacturing agency that helps startups and entrepreneurs develop hardware products from idea to prototype and production. Allen and his family have established a sustainable manufacturing partners network in Asia (Taiwan and China) over the past 30 years, working closely with product designers, engineers and manufacturers, which serves large firms and clients all over the world in multiple  industries. He holds Bachelor in Business Administration from Fu Jen Catholic University in Taiwan (09’) as well as two Master's degrees in Management of Technology (12') and Manufacturing Engineering (13') from New York University.

Konstantin graduated from Union College with a bachelors in EE and a minor in Nanotechnology. He's currently the lead engingeer at MakeSimply. When he's not building technology, he's reading up on science, doing his own beer brewing and making watches.
Sharing is Caring. And makes you an awesome person.

Even if you can’t make a contribution you can still help share the power by sharing our IndieGoGo page with friends to help us get the word out! Every share brings us that much closer to reaching our goal.
Once we reach our targeted funds goal, we'll go right into product tooling and production as soon as possible. We expect to have Juicer units to our backers in the next 3-4 months.

Nick and David are dedicated innovators and businessmen who will keep you updated on major developments with The Juicer without spamming your inbox with constant updates. We’re excited to work with you, IndieGogo-ers.

column5: >Is there a version of the Juicer that shares power between iPhones?

column1: After months of rigorous testing and trial we found it is not technically possible to
share power between iPhones as of the latest model. However, future versions of
The Juicer will continue to test prototypes on future models of the iPhone.

column5: >Can I charge an iPhone from my Android device?

column1: Yes. By simply attaching a micro-usb adapter you can charge your iPhone with the Juicer cable.
Free shipping to US, international charges apply.

column2: press inquiries please email Hello@phonewalletkeys.com

BestBoy - the truly mobile keyboard
Do you still carry around your lap top because you can’t type properly on your tablet or smartphone? New bluetooth keyboard BestBoy is your solution. And this is your shot at making it come true.
The simplest way to describe BestBoy is as a bluetooth keyboard that you stick on the back of your tablet or smartphone. Type by pushing different combinations of the six keys.

column6:
schema=youtube"" width=""580"">
BestBoy in action. It's an old prototype (2011), but the koncept is the same.

column1: It’s based on an old idea, the chorded keyboard. Each letter is a ""chord"". It turns out that just six keys are enough.

BestBoy is intended for those who find answering e-mails or writing longer texts on their touchscreens too slow. Tests have shown that for most people it takes but 40 minutes to get to the same speed with BestBoy as on a normal touchscreen keyboard. With a few hours of using, the speed increases.

Games

Do you miss the physical buttons on your old Nintendo? Do you feel that
the touch screen controls aren’t quite enough? You are not alone. But
there might be a new hope for you. The BestBoy keyboard aims to bring 6
new buttons to the back of your droid/iphone. It’s basically an ordinary
bluetooth keyboard with only 6 keys, it’s super small and sticks right

to the back of your favourite gaming device.

Try it on your PC!
You can even try it out on your computer. Head over to the bestboy.se website and download the java app, and give it a go!

column2:
>
BestBoy concept image for a smartphone.
“In the latest versions we have used Braille, the dot writing used by blind people"", August Bering says. ""It's a little perk, you learn to read blind writing as you learn BestBoy.""

column1: • build a prototype with the new Bluetooth chip
• start production of the first batch of at least 1000 units of the BesBoy keyboard
• write BestBoy training apps for Android and iOS
• start a company to produce and market the BestBoy keyboad
For this we need US $ 50 000 (~ € 36 000), based on costs for prototype
parts, production, app development costs, parts and production of the
When you help us reach this goal, you will be able get your hands on
one or more of the first 1 000 units and become truly mobile.

column2:
/>

The BestBoy keyboard uses Bluetooth Smart, also known as Bluetooth Low Energy, to connect to your device, so you need to have a device with that feature. Most mobile devices releases 2012 and later have support for Bluetooth Smart, you can find a (not necessarily complete) list of compatible devices at bluetooth.com.

column1: To be sure - check the specifications of your device!

The BestBoy Story

It all began a long time ago with a poor software engineer (August) getting a bout of Repetitive Strain Injury
from sitting in front of the computer too much. What on earth are we
thinking, building state of the art soft- and hardware designed after
century-old technology? The QWERTY keyboard is from the 1800′s and the “modern” mouse from the 1970′s, sure we could do better, considering Moore’s law guiding other development?
The first approach to solve my problem was a crude device made out of
toilet rolls, attached to each other with a chord, much like the
Nintendo Wii remotes. While this was great, especially from an aesthetic
point, it meant putting the device down and taking it up as soon the
phone rang or the tea water boiled.

The tablets

I forgot about the project for some time, but then came the iPad. What a great gadget! You could use it almost like a real computer, except you couldn’t do any real work with it of course. That on-screen keyboard was a real pain for someone knowing how to touch-type. I wanted tactile feedback, and touch screens are bad at that.

column2:
>
BestBoy iPad prototype, anno 2011.

column1: I got some help from a couple of friends and we built the
first version of BestBoy for the iPad 2. It was beautiful, complicated
and expensive. Featuring a microprocessor, Bluetooth and real mechanical
buttons, it was a really cool device. And of course, pinning an
additional computer on the back of a tablet computer always sounds like a
great idea to a computer guy like myself.
But still, at this time, we made a promotion video for our
product and BestBoy was featured in the Swedish magazine MacWorld, and
the article is still available online (in Swedish).
The BestBoy 1.0 would be too expensive, clunky and it would need to be
charged. We were having serious doubts about our baby and how to
proceed. People want their smartphone or tablet to be thin, and we would
add some 5 mm to the thickness. Not good.
For eons we dwelled on our misfortune. What about the plans for a new,
better world? Then one foggy night, on a desolate field in the darkest,
most forsaken part of Sweden, I had an idea! We already got a great,
touch sensitive screen on the phone. Why not try to extend that same
area to the back of the device? Nobody have done it before, no, but that

column2:
>
BestBoy touch concept sketch.

column1: As it turned out, it was more or less impossible. We experimented with different materials and ways to use them, but never managed to get it working in the long run....
Other, even more crazy ideas where tested and discarded. Let's just leave it at that.

Finally we had to abandon the touch based idea, and go back to the original idea with bluetooth and electronics. However, time has passed and new technology has emerged. Bluetooth Smart (or Low Energy) uses much less power than normal bluetooth, and was not available when the first BestBoy prototype was built. We also decided to not use mechanical buttons, since they are complicated and expensive.

column2:
>
BestBoy concept image for tablet.

column1: So, just a couple of months later, we’re here. With a simple, thin, light Bluetooth LE based keyboard, with 6 simple touch buttons.

column2:
>BestBoy is ready for production – but in need of funding.


Revolution

column1: Within five years I don’t think people will have both laptop, smartphone and tablet. It’s absurd that we carry so much computing power in our smartphones, and still are unable to put it to real work. I read somewhere that people spend one and a half hours daily on their smartphones, painfully struggling to do what they do on their computers, just slower..
""So someone will revolutionize the world. Hopefully it’s me."" August Bering, creator of BestBoy
Send this to your friends that need to type faster on their mobile devices.
Do you still carry around your lap top because you can’t type properly on your tablet or smartphone? New bluetooth keyboard BestBoy is your solution. And this is your shot at making it come true.
The simplest way to describe BestBoy is as a bluetooth keyboard that you stick on the back of your tablet or smartphone. Type by pushing different combinations of the six keys.
BestBoy in action. It's an old prototype (2011), but the koncept is the same.
It’s based on an old idea, the chorded keyboard. Each letter is a ""chord"". It turns out that just six keys are enough.

BestBoy is intended for those who find answering e-mails or writing longer texts on their touchscreens too slow. Tests have shown that for most people it takes but 40 minutes to get to the same speed with BestBoy as on a normal touchscreen keyboard. With a few hours of using, the speed increases.GamesDo you miss the physical buttons on your old Nintendo? Do you feel that
the touch screen controls aren’t quite enough? You are not alone. But
there might be a new hope for you. The BestBoy keyboard aims to bring 6
new buttons to the back of your droid/iphone. It’s basically an ordinary
bluetooth keyboard with only 6 keys, it’s super small and sticks right
to the back of your favourite gaming device.Try it on your PC!
You can even try it out on your computer. Head over to the bestboy.se website and download the java app, and give it a go!

BestBoy concept image for a smartphone.“In the latest versions we have used Braille, the dot writing used by blind people"", August Bering says. ""It's a little perk, you learn to read blind writing as you learn BestBoy.""
What We Need & What You Get
build a prototype with the new Bluetooth chip
start production of the first batch of at least 1000 units of the BesBoy keyboard
write BestBoy training apps for Android and iOS
start a company to produce and market the BestBoy keyboad
For this we need US $ 50 000 (~ € 36 000), based on costs for prototype
parts, production, app development costs, parts and production of the
When you help us reach this goal, you will be able get your hands on
one or more of the first 1 000 units and become truly mobile.

The BestBoy keyboard uses Bluetooth Smart, also known as Bluetooth Low Energy, to connect to your device, so you need to have a device with that feature. Most mobile devices releases 2012 and later have support for Bluetooth Smart, you can find a (not necessarily complete) list of compatible devices at bluetooth.com.
To be sure - check the specifications of your device!
The BestBoy StoryIt all began a long time ago with a poor software engineer (August) getting a bout of Repetitive Strain Injury
from sitting in front of the computer too much. What on earth are we
thinking, building state of the art soft- and hardware designed after
century-old technology? The QWERTY keyboard is from the 1800′s and the “modern” mouse from the 1970′s, sure we could do better, considering Moore’s law guiding other development?
The first approach to solve my problem was a crude device made out of
toilet rolls, attached to each other with a chord, much like the
Nintendo Wii remotes. While this was great, especially from an aesthetic
point, it meant putting the device down and taking it up as soon the
phone rang or the tea water boiled.

The tabletsI forgot about the project for some time, but then came the iPad. What a great gadget! You could use it almost like a real computer, except you couldn’t do any real work with it of course. That on-screen keyboard was a real pain for someone knowing how to touch-type. I wanted tactile feedback, and touch screens are bad at that.
I got some help from a couple of friends and we built the
first version of BestBoy for the iPad 2. It was beautiful, complicated
and expensive. Featuring a microprocessor, Bluetooth and real mechanical
buttons, it was a really cool device. And of course, pinning an
additional computer on the back of a tablet computer always sounds like a
great idea to a computer guy like myself.
But still, at this time, we made a promotion video for our
product and BestBoy was featured in the Swedish magazine MacWorld, and
the article is still available online (in Swedish).
The BestBoy 1.0 would be too expensive, clunky and it would need to be
charged. We were having serious doubts about our baby and how to
proceed. People want their smartphone or tablet to be thin, and we would
add some 5 mm to the thickness. Not good.
For eons we dwelled on our misfortune. What about the plans for a new,
better world? Then one foggy night, on a desolate field in the darkest,
most forsaken part of Sweden, I had an idea! We already got a great,
touch sensitive screen on the phone. Why not try to extend that same
area to the back of the device? Nobody have done it before, no, but that
As it turned out, it was more or less impossible. We experimented with different materials and ways to use them, but never managed to get it working in the long run....
Other, even more crazy ideas where tested and discarded. Let's just leave it at that.

Finally we had to abandon the touch based idea, and go back to the original idea with bluetooth and electronics. However, time has passed and new technology has emerged. Bluetooth Smart (or Low Energy) uses much less power than normal bluetooth, and was not available when the first BestBoy prototype was built. We also decided to not use mechanical buttons, since they are complicated and expensive.
So, just a couple of months later, we’re here. With a simple, thin, light Bluetooth LE based keyboard, with 6 simple touch buttons.
BestBoy is ready for production – but in need of funding.Revolution

Within five years I don’t think people will have both laptop, smartphone and tablet. It’s absurd that we carry so much computing power in our smartphones, and still are unable to put it to real work. I read somewhere that people spend one and a half hours daily on their smartphones, painfully struggling to do what they do on their computers, just slower..
So someone will revolutionize the world. Hopefully it’s me."" August Bering, creator of BestBoy
Please, help us spread the word!
Send this to your friends that need to type faster on their mobile devices.

Inspired by Vancouver Canucks vs Boston Bruins NHL Stanley Cup Finals in 2010, which ended in a now infamous riot, three Vancouver fans came up with the idea of an online arena where loyal fans, like themselves, could connect with other fans. We wanted to know what everyone was saying and who the best fans really were!

Chirplocker.com wants to help make you a better fan! Chirplocker is a social network and game for sports fan. We cut out the noise and bring a razor sharp focus to each of your favorite team’s match ups. From there, you compete head to head with the fans of rival teams.

We have successfully launched our beta prototype for the head to head fan arena. And, we love it! For the past year we have done everything ourselves! That’s great, but it’s painstakingly slow. If we want to take this from a rough beta to the next level, we need funding!
Our blog - blog.chirplocker.com (articles about fans)

This concept really only works if we can build apps for fans to use at the game and on the go. We are looking to hire mobile developers Android and IOS apps. Do you know how tedious those things are! Also, we need fans in there using the site. Imagine Facebook with no friends! So, we need to also spend a little on advertising and get the word out.

So, what are we going to give you? We have some great perks that you really cannot put a price on. To start, we are pre-selling our site subscriptions at a huge discount. Chirplocker is free to use. But, if you want to be a real star, you are going to need a little help. Our subscriptions offer you the ability to sway the game in your favor.
• 5 Bonus ‘Votes’ – Get even more fire power
• 1 Superpost per game – Make sure everyone sees your textual genius
• Last Word – In any conversation, getting the last word is just so satisfying. Get time to chirp after everyone else is locked out from commenting

Influence
Votes are similar to likes or dislikes in Reddit. Whoever gets your cheer gets an extra point for their score and their teams fan score. If you boo them, they lose a point. As a rookie you only get so many. So, fans that subscribe can vote more often.
Fan Ranks (the higher you get, the more you influence the game)

Status
Does that sound boring? Fine. How about a lifetime subscription and your profile is permanently set to the nearly unattainable status of Living Legend? That status comes with perks of its own like extra votes, increased salary, and crazy street credit.

The Chirplocker Girls!
Not enough? How about a night out with the Chirplocker girls as your personal fun ambassadors?

And lastly, fame!
We are offering our most premium subscribers acting roles in a web series call ""Fan Camp"".  In fan camp, promising fans train to be better fans. Our experienced fan coach will drive you through drills and challenges that will push you to the limit.
• Carrying several beers at once through a crowd
Check out our quick and dirty celebration of the return of the NHL after the lockout, Welcome Back NHL.

This is huge. Reaching our funding goal will make this year long obsession to create something truly remarkable for sports fans worth all the work. We have a great team of highly motivated and skilled people. With this funding we can hire the extra help to quickly build the game you will surely love!

If you don’t have $10 but still want to help out because you think we are great guys, please tell a friend who is crazy about sports. Even better, make them like our Facebook page, www.facebook.com/chirplocker, follow us on twitter, @twitter, and sign up for an account and pick your favorite team!

IMPORTANT: If you live outside of Canada you MUST add $8.00 at checkout. Sorry.
