column1: Is warranty provided when purchasing an U1 Labs Smartphone?

column5: >Labs products come with a 12 months warranty.

column1: RadialOS© is U1Labs’ very own operating system based on Android OS, which brings about the best of productivity coupled with a minimalistic UI design so that you can achieve more in your daily lives. All your favourite android apps will be available to you on the Radial OS in the most minimalistic form of android.
What can I do if my U1Labs product doesn't work properly?

U1Labs guarantees a full refund warranty for damaged goods during the 12 months warranty time and for goods that are not received by the stipulated date. If your U1 malfunctions based on hardware faults, you can send it back to us and we will exchange it at no cost for you.
Each order will include, U1 Phone, AC Power Charger (according to your origin country), USB data cable and English User manual.
What is the shipping guarantee on all products?

Stipulated date from our factory is 50 days from which batch production is ongoing and will be shipped within that time frame. As we are a start-up we have to be truthful about our timeline with prospective buyers and with the ever increasing support ,henceforth we are placing a 50 day shipping guarantee in which failing for the item to be shipped within that timeline buyers can expect a full non-disputable refund from our side.
We are a small team and at times we might get overwhelmed by the complexity of what this project involves. We learn every day from each other and from each obstacle which has come our way.

More than we would like to, we depend on external factors and unfortunately we have had partners failing us, which has undoubtedly affected our expected calendar. However, we have always been honest to our supporters and challengers.
We now know that there are many variables, but we are doing our best and we are growing every day.
We have turned a sketch into a tangible product  and despite our challenges, now we need you to bring the U1 in your hands and shops near you!

We believe that being Premium is not a price tag, but a philosophy – a way of life. For the very first time,  U1 brings premium quality design, craftsmanship, and unique features, all accessible within the palm of your hands.

U1 Labs brought together ex Samsung and Huawei engineers to help us achieve the quality and slow motion aspect of the device which took 6 months. Industry experts who are passionate about their work. The team that built the U1 kept the design integrity intact while working on making the design hardware go perfectly in Sync with future proof hardware.
The U1 has already been mentioned in the media and we hope that many more will soon follow.

This is it, U1 The Beast©! From the drawing board, to production and soon, to your hands. The world's first 480fps Smartphone, with an aluminium body and powered by a 4000 mAh battery, the U1 brings you a unique experience, accessible premium, just for you!

Capture life’s greatest moments with Beast’s 20.7MP rear IMX220 sensor paired with the Mediatek Helio X10 enables 480fps slow motion video recording and a 8MP front facing camera. Equipped with Dual Tone LED flash, The Beast© is nothing less than a full-fledged DSLR, helping you capture life greatest moments in vivid, vibrant colours.

The U1 houses a 4000mAh beast of a battery with Dual IC protection design that goes the extra mile to give you an uninterrupted smartphone experience and longer battery backup. We are dedicated to offering you a reliable phone, making sure it never fails you when you need it the most.

With the Helio X10 leading the way, and paired with the IMX220 optics, real hardware slow motion is enabled at an astonishing 480FPS at 1080P.*Video Credit: Mediatek for reference purposeThe U1 has a 2560 x
1440px 2k Display with 16 million colours, so don’t
be surprised if your images come to life.At a sleek 157*76.8*9.4mm thickness,
5’5 inch display and a 160g lightweight frame, the U1 has been exclusively
comfortably in the palm of your hands as well as your pockets.

notifications, and more without having to unlock your Beast. Productivity is now a swipe

Short Summary

PowerUp can charge any microUSB or lightning device by taking power from most devices Android to Android (Micro-usb), Android To iPhone(Lighting), it can also move files between devices, like photos, videos etc.

column2:
What You GetWe Have This Product Ready to production, We just need to make a fund to order the production.
As soon as our goal is reached, we don't have to wait for the campaign to finish: we can start the production.

column1:
F.A.Q.


How can I choose which phone to charge and what to withdraw energy from?
PowerUp has In and Out printed on the cable. Just plug the ""In"" side on the device
you want to charge, and the ""out"" side on the device you want to take energy
It depends on the device you take the power from. Usually, tablets
or more powerful devices can charge faster, but there's no general rule.
Can I charge my GoPro from an iPhone?
No you can't. There's no way, at the time, to grab energy from an
Apple device. See the Compatibility section for more informations.
Can I charge my device from my Nexus 6P?
No, you can't withdraw energy through the USB-C adapter.
Any microUSB or lightning device can be charged by PowerUp. You can
grab power from any microUSB OTG device. For Android, you can check if
your device supports OTG with USB OTG Checker.
Sure, but please let us know at least one week before we ship!
We test EVERY cable before shipping. In the unlikely case you face some issue contact us, we can still send you another one.
• Tell your family and friends about our new app!
• Use the Indiegogo share tools to share our campaign !

Unlike other tags, we don't think you should have to send a product back to a
factory to have batteries replaced. It's not good design. It's not good business. And
it's not green. That's why we made Ty rechargeable.
We also made Ty for Android and iOS users. The app is free and full
of useful features. With Places, you can set a safe zone, for example, to ""Home"" or
""Office"", using GPS. As you move within the zone, alarms will be disabled so you won't
be bothered, but if you leave Home without either phone or Ty-tagged item, both will
alarm before you get too far away.
As Ty grows, new features will be added and our network will expand to include a

with our factory and vendors refining designs and completing production tools for Ty
products and accessories. Our suppliers are ready for mass production. Ty’s
campaign proceeds will be used to fund our first mass production order.

Follow this link to see the video without flashplayer.
Babuino allows you to control your digital devices with your smatphone, in an easy way.
You just have to connect your babuino to a USB port of the device you want to control, and start our program on your phone
Connecting with babuino is trouble free and it does not need any configuration.
You can also control your smartphone from your computer (PC or Mac), now you can write your messages from a regular keyboard. It works in android devices, iPad and iPhone with jailbreak.
With babuino, you can use your smartphone to control lot of things, computers, toys, homemade electronics... and practically any digital device.

When we started developing babuino, we thought in people who just want to use our technology, without knowing anything about how does it works, but if you are interrested we will give you all information.
Babuino will be shipped as a 100% finished product, and it will come with lot of software to use it from minute one.
But at the same time, we want to offer a usefull and powerfull product for that people who want to make their own projects, so we developed babuino as a full open project.
We have to models, babuino stick and babuino board.
Well, these 2 versions of babuino are pretty similar.
Babuino stick comes on a transparent case (like a pendrive) so you can bring it with you everywhere. You have seen several of its uses on the promotional video.

Babuino board comes unboxed. It have accesible pins, so you can connect more electronic components to it. It´s a very small board, arduino compatible, bluetooth ready,  and with the power of the xmega microcontroller.
If you do not know which one to choose, we suggest babuino stick, or even better, both.

Both versions have basically the same hardware, so don´t worry about which is better, because they are equal. You just have to decide, if you want babuino with a case (stick) or without case and accesible ports (board).
All software that you have seen in the video is open source, so you can modify or use as a base for your projects, even for commercial projects.
Smartphone's programs are for the android platform.
Desktop's programs have versions for Windows, Mac and Linux
Our firmware is based on LUFA. You will be able to use your arduino sketches with Babunino, because it's an arduino compatible board with integrated bluetooth.
We have done a lot, but there is much more to be done.
We have done the first prototypes, but we need more prototypes before babuino is ready for production.
We have lot of software for babuino under development. We use it, and we love it, but we know there is much to be done before it reach the quality we want it to have.
We know this is a fantastic product, and we want to make it available for everybody for a great price, so we need your contribution to make a large production.
We love our project, and we hope you like it, if so, please get involved, support us.
Can you give me more technical information about babuino hardware?
Of course. As we have told you, is a 100% Arduino compatible board.
We have developed the video prototypes with the ATMega32U4 microcontroller, but the final version, will come with the powerfull ATXMega128A1U microcontroller.
We have try to make babuino as tiny as possible. Despite its small size, babuino integrates a Master/Slave selectable Bluetooth 2.0 module, and a Infrared transmitter and receiver.
Babuino stick is powered with the USB port, and babuino board can be powered with the USB port, batteries or with an external power adapter.
Babuino board have accesible ports for you to connect anything you want.
Here you have a provisional schematic of the prototypes:

We are not lawyers or accountants. We have contacted our local tax office and for them this is not a donation, but a presale. We do not agree with them but we can not do anything about it. Any supporter from an EU country must pay VAT (Spainsh VAT is 21%). We know this is an extra effort for our EU residents contributors and we appreciate it greatly.
Shipping cost is 5$ for any country in the world.
See the following table to know your total cost with shipping and VAT applicable in EU countries.

Hackey is a Wi-Fi connected, palm size key switch. Hackey gives you a simple and easy way to control internet related services just by turning the key.
Create your own settings and functions to make
Send a trigger to Zapier to control your smart lock or to Call a taxi.

column2: >Or send a trigger to IFTTT Maker Channel to control home security.
>This is possible because Hackey can be used to send a HTTP POST request to IFTTT Maker Channel, Zapier as well as your own original service by simply turning the key.

column1: When a package is delivered to your home or
office, the Hackey LEDs can flash green. When your service receives a news alert, the Hackey LEDs can flash purple.

column1: other services and Hackey’s side LED indicators will then flash in accordance

column2: >Do you prefer other switches? Hackey's switch is easy to customize. The key switch can be replaced by other standard φ16 switches on the market. You can replace the key switch with, for example, a push button switch or make a custom switch by yourself using 3D printers.

column1: *Hackey needs a power supply when in use.
• Only a key holder can turn it. (100 different patterns)
• You can assign different actions for tuning on the key and turning it off.
• Avoids pets, children or other people turning the switch accidentally.
(We may not able to ship to countries that need other certifications. In that case we will refund your order.)
The LED colour options can be used to easily identify multiple Hackeys.
The following items will be included in one package of Hackey.
Technical information on Hackey can be checked on our online manual.

Exhibited at SXSW

Hackey was unveiled this year at SXSW, in Austin, Texas from March 15th to 18th.
Hackey has been covered on a wide variety of media sites:
Hackey was designed in Akihbara, Tokyo, Japan. After prototypes were made in Japan, mass production was done by our Taiwan factory.
Painting at Tokyo labo facility.
Prototypes made in the Tokyo studio.
Development and mass production of Hackey has been completed and the first batch of Hackeys are now in the warehouse ready to be shipped.

We will sell Hackey no matter whether this campaign succeeds or not but we want to use Indiegogo to help spread the news about Hackey to wider audience. With the wide range of successful connected devices backed on Indiegogo we feel Hackey is ideally suited to launch on Indiegogo and we hope that our backers and first users will help spread word about Hackey from Indiegogo to the world.
","Hackey could make controlling your smart home as simple as turning a key - VentureBeat
鍵を回すと洗剤が届く""、鍵型スイッチデバイスHackeyが販売開始。ワンアクションでWebサービスと連動 - Engadget Japanese
Hackey is a Wi-Fi connected, palm size key switch. Hackey gives you a simple and easy way to control internet related services just by turning the key.
Create your own settings and functions to make
Send a trigger to Zapier to control your smart lock or to Call a taxi.
Or send a trigger to IFTTT Maker Channel to control home security.
This is possible because Hackey can be used to send a HTTP POST request to IFTTT Maker Channel, Zapier as well as your own original service by simply turning the key.
When a package is delivered to your home or
office, the Hackey LEDs can flash green. When your service receives a news alert, the Hackey LEDs can flash purple.
Hackey can receive HTTP GET requests from
other services and Hackey’s side LED indicators will then flash in accordance

Do you prefer other switches? Hackey's switch is easy to customize. The key switch can be replaced by other standard φ16 switches on the market. You can replace the key switch with, for example, a push button switch or make a custom switch by yourself using 3D printers.
*Hackey needs a power supply when in use.
Because Hackey's switch is a key
Only a key holder can turn it. (100 different patterns)
You can assign different actions for tuning on the key and turning it off.
Avoids pets, children or other people turning the switch accidentally.
(We may not able to ship to countries that need other certifications. In that case we will refund your order.)
The LED colour options can be used to easily identify multiple Hackeys.
The following items will be included in one package of Hackey.
Technical information on Hackey can be checked on our online manual.
Exhibited at SXSWHackey was unveiled this year at SXSW, in Austin, Texas from March 15th to 18th.
Hackey has been covered on a wide variety of media sites:
Hackey was designed in Akihbara, Tokyo, Japan. After prototypes were made in Japan, mass production was done by our Taiwan factory.
Prototypes made in the Tokyo studio.
Development and mass production of Hackey has been completed and the first batch of Hackeys are now in the warehouse ready to be shipped.

We will sell Hackey no matter whether this campaign succeeds or not but we want to use Indiegogo to help spread the news about Hackey to wider audience. With the wide range of successful connected devices backed on Indiegogo we feel Hackey is ideally suited to launch on Indiegogo and we hope that our backers and first users will help spread word about Hackey from Indiegogo to the world.",21.0,1,"1 Campaign

The Only Smartphone Companion Specially Designed for Women

What is BagRing ?

It's a usefull and stylish object that clings to the handbag when you walk and hangs your purse when you are sitting.
• You can see if you have new e-mail
• And you can see how many calories you burn walking

Without pulling your phone out of your purse !

Usefull

Know who's calling you, without pulling your phone out of your purse. Take a coffee, sit, hang your bag and be aware if you have mail, texts or missed calls. Once you're on your way always keep track of every step so at the end of the day you know how many calories you've burn !
column6:
>Stylish Design

BagRing is not only usefull, it's also a beautiful object. Several colors available.

column1:
FAQ

Why ?

Because i saw so many women struggle with their purse to find their smartphone.

So it's only for women ?

I thought primarily to women but men who have bags can also use BagRing!

Why do you need so much money ?

I've set a goal of $81,700, which will allow me to begin serial manufacturing and make BagRing widely available as soon as July 2014. If the goal is not reached, you will be refunded. Every dollar raised through Indiegogo will go directly to manufacturing of BagRing devices.

Who is behind this project ? and why should I help you ?

I am French, I live in Paris and I've always worked in technology. I will soon be 33 years old and I have participated in the creation of a software vendor company. This project is great, it starts from a simple idea and can change the lives of millions of women. I dream of walking down the street and see all the handbags with BagRing.

How i set up BagRing ?

With the iOS or Android application (iOS 7.0 and higher / Android 4.3 and higher).


What are the specifications ?
• Multilingual : English, French, Spanish, German, Japanes, Chinese, Russian

column6:
>Do I need a smartphone to use BagRing ?

Yes. BagRing uses Bluetooth® to transmit calls, texts and e-mails from your smartphone.


When will I get the chance to receive my BagRing ?

Shipping begin August 30th, 2014 for the Indiegogo perks.
column7:
>Retail general availability date estimate: October 30th, 2014


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

You can help me!

Even if you can't get a BagRing, if you find it interesting, don't hesitate to share.

JailBase wants to create a mobile app. We already have a successful website and want to create a great mobile app to go with it. One of the biggest features we are going to add is facial recognition. This will allow you to take a picture with your mobile phone and search for arrest information by face.
We have the design of the mobile app and we have a prototype of our facial recognition technology. We need your support and pledges to make this project a success!

JailBase is a free website that provides jail arrest photos, jail information, and arrest notifications to the general public. My name is James, and I am the founder of JailBase. I started the site three years ago because I had a family need for timely and accurate jail arrest information, but it just wasn't available. I felt there had to be a better way, and decided to create a fast and efficient online database of my local county jail using public records. Today, JailBase collects data from over 160 counties all across the US, and we continue to grow every month.

Facial recognition has been around for decades. It will allow the user to search for arrest information using the faces found in the pictures they take. However only recently has the technology become more accurate and more affordable to implement.

Software development is not an issue for us. I myself have over 15 years of development experience in addition to managing the development of JailBase. Most of our budget will be going towards two things. One will be the licensing for the facial recognition software. The second will be the graphic design of the mobile app so it will function smoothly and look professional.

If we double our funding goal, we plan to add additional features to the app. One of those features will be Face Notification. This will allow you to save a face to search for, and if someone who matches that face is arrested in the future, we will notify you.

JailBase has always provided a free service to the public with our website. The mobile app will be free also, however the free version will have advertisements and usage will be limited. Advertisements can be turned off and additional usage can be bought by purchasing credits. As a backer, you have the potential to get unlimited use of the application and no in-app advertising.
Check out the perks on the right. Your contribution of any amount will make this project a success. Pledge Now!

JailBase is a huge database. Enabling facial recognition on our millions of photos is a technical challenge. However servers are cheap and we have designed JailBase to be affordable and scalable from the beginning. This allows us to handle massive amounts of traffic and data. We have planed our facial recognition system in the same fashion. We have developed a working prototype and are confident that we will be able to implement it across our database.

Another risk is the accuracy of facial recognition. It's good today but it can always be improved. Facial recognition has been around for a long time and it's accuracy has improved incrementally over the years. When new advancements are made or new algorithms come out, our design allows us to make rapid updates. This allows accuracy to constantly improve so we can provide you with the best accuracy we can.

We know we can get this done with your support. Any amount you can contribute will help. Let us know if you have any questions or comments. Thanks!

The VoltWerks linear supply provides adjustable DC power for lab and system use. No clunky knobs and a fast current trip keep accurate power available exactly when it's needed.

column1: Precision comes from dual 25-turn trimmers for accurate and dependable voltage and current-trip adjustment. The low-noise linear regulator has less than 2mV p-p output noise, a level of performance not found on low-cost power supplies.
Pre-order VoltWerks and add precision power to your lab!
Getting started with the VoltWerks power supply is easy!
• Connect to included power supply or USB port
• 5mV voltage accuracy with less than 1mVp-p noise
• Up to 2 Amps from other sources (see specifications)
• Digital control via Power Good Output and Enable Input

Most of us have a box of old AC power adapters, salvaged from lost or broken electronic devices. VoltWerks lets you upcycle the adapters into useful lab equipment for your next project. Almost any AC adapter with a DC output from 5-15V is a candidate for providing input power to the VoltWerks VW1.
The User Manual documentation will have simple instructions for making the conversion. Save yourself money and reduce waste!
After several prototype generations the VoltWerks VW1 design is up, running, and fully functional.

We have 3D printed enclosures and characterization of the final prototype is complete. Small firmware, mechanical, and circuit adjustments are in progress: tweaking details that matter, like LED brightness. The final steps are hard-tooling for the enclosure and full-scale manufacturing.

The idea for the VoltWerks power supply came from the realization that neither my expensive HP/Agilent power supply, nor my low-cost lab supply were a good fit for many of my development requirements. With a traditional bench supply it is easy to accidentally or thoughtlessly mess with the settings and set the wrong voltage.
• No clunky knobs, but also no programming or keypads.
• Current trip, not current limit. If the current exceeds the set-point, I want power cut, not limited.
• Low-noise. Many of the adjustable lab supplies today are switch-mode and are too noisy when working with analog stages such as ADCs.
The VW1 design has hit all these goals and more.
Now, with your backing, VoltWerks VW1 will start shipping and appearing on a lab bench near you!
Revely Microsystems was started in 2003 to create development boards for ARM microprocessors - shipping our products to over 30 different countries.

Revely Microsystems is located in Austin, Texas and the VoltWerks project is very Austin-centric. Our industrial design and board assembly partners are both local. We benefit greatly from the high-tech talent and energy found in Austin.

The VW1 power supply will be the first in a long line of innovative VoltWerks lab products from Revely Microsystems.

column2: >The team right now is me, Jon Guy. Of course I'm supported by some first-class contractors and partners for design and manufacturing, as well as advisors, family and friends.

column1: I've been leading teams and designing products for over 20 years, in both established companies like Texas Instruments and Fisher&
column2: Paykel, but also with multiple start-up companies. I've lead teams and been hands-on with in a wide range of applications including motor control, automation of factories/buildings/horticultural equipment, wearables, and semiconductors. Big project or small, I love to make it happen.

column1: The characterization of prototypes is complete but there's still the possibility of a late feature or specification change (for better or worse). Frankly the product design is pretty simple compared to most of the embedded products I’ve designed so the product risks are low.
Having been through this before, there's always a risk for delay if the T0 molded parts aren't right. The enclosure design is deliberately simple, so any delays should be in weeks, not months.

The biggest risk in manufacturing is component lead-times. As a hedge, inventory of several key components has already been purchased. Even with good planning, component lead-times beyond our control may delay volume order fulfillment.
Can I control the VoltWerks Model 1 using USB?

No, the VW1 does not have communication interfaces. The USB connector is only used for 5V power input. While USB programmability was a consideration, the design objectives were simplicity and foolproof operation. The end product is essentially an analog design. The MCU is used for the LCD readouts and system management and does not control regulation.
Can I power VW1 directly from a vehicle 12V supply?

Yes. However some degree of protection from the extreme conditions seen on an automotive 12V system is preferable, especially for permanent installations. Input protection to the VW1 might include a fuse, additional transient voltage suppressor, and/or a pre-regulator if low-noise output under all conditions is required. If your 'vehicle' is a robot powered by a 12V SLA battery, then there are no special considerations.
Since it is a linear regulator, does the VW1 get hot?

Depending on the input voltage, output voltage and load current the VW1 heat-sink can get quite hot. The VW1 power-supply uses a linear regulator to control voltage. A linear regulator is essentially a big power resistor with a dynamically regulated resistance. The power loss is the difference between the supply voltage and the output voltage multiplied by the current P = (Vin-Vout) x Iload. Linear power regulators are generally less efficient than switching power supplies, but offer superior noise, ripple and start-up characteristics.
An internal temperature sensor will signal a fault condition if a safe limit is exceeded.

For U.S. customers, our prices include free shipping. International customers, please add $16 dollars to help cover the extra shipping cost. Please note that international customers are responsible for all duties, taxes, and fees that may apply to receiving their order.

column6: >An innovative revolutionary intercommunication alarm clock, modernly designed with every user and setting in mind.

column1: There isn't anything confusing about this equation! The Clockee Talkee provides functions such as a Walkie-Talkie, alarm clock, thermometer, sound activation and other capabilities like power saving and broadcast mode!
Why do you need a Clockee Talkee?

Everyone needs a Clockee Talkee! This revolutionary design is perfect for the everyday ordinary and unique lifestyles. Not only does the Clockee Talkee provide a modern sleek wood grain design, the applications are unlimited! You'll be sure to have faster more efficient communication throughout your workplace or home once you receive your very own Clockee Talkee... Guaranteed! Lets look at some settings where the Clockee Talkee is useful!
Often times at home we find it frustrating getting everyone to
arrive around the dinner table on time, or are so tied up with work and forget
to say goodnight to our loved ones.  We dont believe that we are
communicating as effective or efficiently as we would like. We are connecting
with one another via cellphones, yelling or nomadically meeting with each other
which can become physically and financially straining, depending on the
individual. If you have messy hands from working or cooking dinner, are busy,
have a disability, or just plain lazy, we don't always want or can leave our
work space or push multiple buttons and wait patiently to connect on a cell
phone to communicate. We thought there must be an easier way to communicate
more efficiently and that wasn't as bulky, ugly and pricey as today’s intercom
systems. This was our spark! We had thought to expand this idea of easier
communication and to include functions that are also extremely useful
instance the relevant temperature, sound activated functions for the dirty busy
hands, and broadcast mode to communicate up to eight individuals in eight
separate rooms inside and outside of the home or work place. If anyone is like
ourselves, we think you’ll love the Clockee Talkee!
The Clockee Talkee consists of nine main parts. These items are
the transmitter, receiver, crystal, speaker, microphone, LED, clock IC,
thermometer, and power source.  The transmitter sends your voice, after it
has been made into a radio signal, to the other Clockee-Talkee you are
communicating with. The receiver picks up the radio signal that the transmitter
from the other Clockee Talkee sent. The crystal sets the frequency or channels
that the Clockee Talkee's using.  They must be on the same frequency to
communicate. The speaker is the part that takes the signal picked up by the
receiver and amplifies it, so that it is loud enough to be heard. The
microphone is the part that you speak into, and it converts your voice into an
electronic signal. It is the exact opposite of the speaker which converts
electronic signals into voices.  The LED (light emitting diode) is the
display in which you can see the time and menu functions.  LED’s have a
very long life expectancy and can be made in an array of colors.  Clock IC
(input control) is essentially the brain of the clock, keeps the time and sets
the alarms.  The thermometer reads the temperature of any give room or
area. The power source is a type of battery or AC current being used.
CLOCKEE TALKEE 101
One on one communication: Wirelessly communicate with
Broadcast: Send a message to ALL the Clockee Talkee's
Up to 8 Channels: Have a private conversation
by setting the Clockee Talkee to a                                           distinct channel.
1 Km Range: This distance is based on
Sound activation: Clap to your clock to
look makes a great decorative piece.

very close attention to.  The Talk button will be finished in a seamless

as possible.  The current state of the talk button is disguised beneath

column1: transmitter/receiver. You can use the Clockee Talkee anywhere.  It does
NOT require an internet connection or home networking router.

column2: >We have completed our working prototype capable of all the

journey reaching this stage and we are eager to complete this project.  We
have been fortunate to not have to reinvent the wheel as all the technologies
used in the Clockee Talkee are off the shelf parts.  Our unique
combination of design and simple technology assures our backer that we WILL
deliver on our promise.  We have our manufacturer ready to begin working
on the mold and PCB integration.

mold will also take place during this stage.  The mold is a complex and

quantity (kind of like a muffin tray).

through vigorous compliance testing governed by two

Hi Indiegogo my name is Milad Modir and it has been my dream to present to you the Clockee Talkee. After completing a three year advanced diploma in Wireless Communications &
column2: Network at Humber College, I further perused my educational career at Ryerson University completing a Bachelors of Commerce focusing on Telecommunications and Information Technology Management. After successfully working several years in various positions at Bell, Canada’s top telecommunications company, I finally decided to succumbed to my entrepreneurial itch and pioneered the first ever wearable multimedia OLED name tag, formally known as the SuperSales Tag. Recently, you may have seen me on the hit CBC-TV show Dragons Den where I had received $.1 million based on the success of my SuperSales Tag invention. It has received rave reviews and continues to sell as a hot commodity. I fully expect to do the same with the Clockee Talkee
column3: delivering unique, high performance efficient communication products like we have been doing for the past 8 years!

Clockee Talkee: clock radios and walkie-talkie: If you are in search of an alarm clock - @IT_SKILL_CENTER
An innovative revolutionary intercommunication alarm clock, modernly designed with every user and setting in mind.

There isn't anything confusing about this equation! The Clockee Talkee provides functions such as a Walkie-Talkie, alarm clock, thermometer, sound activation and other capabilities like power saving and broadcast mode!
Why do you need a Clockee Talkee?

Everyone needs a Clockee Talkee! This revolutionary design is perfect for the everyday ordinary and unique lifestyles. Not only does the Clockee Talkee provide a modern sleek wood grain design, the applications are unlimited! You'll be sure to have faster more efficient communication throughout your workplace or home once you receive your very own Clockee Talkee... Guaranteed! Lets look at some settings where the Clockee Talkee is useful!
Often times at home we find it frustrating getting everyone to
arrive around the dinner table on time, or are so tied up with work and forget
to say goodnight to our loved ones.  We dont believe that we are
communicating as effective or efficiently as we would like. We are connecting
with one another via cellphones, yelling or nomadically meeting with each other
which can become physically and financially straining, depending on the
individual. If you have messy hands from working or cooking dinner, are busy,
have a disability, or just plain lazy, we don't always want or can leave our
work space or push multiple buttons and wait patiently to connect on a cell
phone to communicate. We thought there must be an easier way to communicate
more efficiently and that wasn't as bulky, ugly and pricey as today’s intercom
systems. This was our spark! We had thought to expand this idea of easier
communication and to include functions that are also extremely useful
instance the relevant temperature, sound activated functions for the dirty busy
hands, and broadcast mode to communicate up to eight individuals in eight
separate rooms inside and outside of the home or work place. If anyone is like
ourselves, we think you’ll love the Clockee Talkee!
The Clockee Talkee consists of nine main parts. These items are
the transmitter, receiver, crystal, speaker, microphone, LED, clock IC,
thermometer, and power source.  The transmitter sends your voice, after it
has been made into a radio signal, to the other Clockee-Talkee you are
communicating with. The receiver picks up the radio signal that the transmitter
from the other Clockee Talkee sent. The crystal sets the frequency or channels
that the Clockee Talkee's using.  They must be on the same frequency to
communicate. The speaker is the part that takes the signal picked up by the
receiver and amplifies it, so that it is loud enough to be heard. The
microphone is the part that you speak into, and it converts your voice into an
electronic signal. It is the exact opposite of the speaker which converts
electronic signals into voices.  The LED (light emitting diode) is the
display in which you can see the time and menu functions.  LED’s have a
very long life expectancy and can be made in an array of colors.  Clock IC
(input control) is essentially the brain of the clock, keeps the time and sets
the alarms.  The thermometer reads the temperature of any give room or
area. The power source is a type of battery or AC current being used.
One on one communication: Wirelessly communicate with
Broadcast: Send a message to ALL the Clockee Talkee's
Up to 8 Channels: Have a private conversation
by setting the Clockee Talkee to a                                           distinct channel.
1 Km Range: This distance is based on
Sound activation: Clap to your clock to
look makes a great decorative piece.
Black, Brown, White, Blue, Pink, Silver
Battery: 3XAAA Batteries can be used to take the Clockee
Dimensions: L(4"") x W(4"") x H(4"")*
Power supply: USB cabale to AC adaptor
It's time to send you off to the real world (tears)
The Clockee Talkee button is something that we have been paying
very close attention to.  The Talk button will be finished in a seamless
and flush elegant look.  Our goal is to make all buttons to be as discrete
as possible.  The current state of the talk button is disguised beneath
the veneer finish as shown in the below pictures.  A diode is used as the
talk button to allow a slight glow effect when pressed.  When completing
prototypes it is very difficult and costly to produce a final design product as
the mold is incomplete.  Rest assured that we will deliver a stellar
The Clockee talkee uses a simple yet effective FM
transmitter/receiver. You can use the Clockee Talkee anywhere.  It does
NOT require an internet connection or home networking router.
We have completed our working prototype capable of all the
functions listed above and shown in the video.  It has been a very long
journey reaching this stage and we are eager to complete this project.  We
have been fortunate to not have to reinvent the wheel as all the technologies
used in the Clockee Talkee are off the shelf parts.  Our unique
combination of design and simple technology assures our backer that we WILL
deliver on our promise.  We have our manufacturer ready to begin working
on the mold and PCB integration.
this phase we will integrate our PCB (circuit board) into one compact
efficient design eliminating redundancy   The creation of the
mold will also take place during this stage.  The mold is a complex and
costly process that allows manufacturers to produce one product in mass
quantity (kind of like a muffin tray).
products that will be sold in North America and Europe
which emit radio frequency must go
through vigorous compliance testing governed by two
different bodies.  This is done to insure end users are safe and
that no frequency interference occurs with government infrastructure.
Phase 3: Pre-production & quality control - At this
stage we will have a completely finished product and ready for a test
production run to insure the manufacture process will be smooth.  We then
initiate stringent quality control procedures (my specialty) to insure the
consistence and longevity of our product.
Phase 4: Mass Production - The production line is
now at full capacity and we are continuously watching for any errors.
product is safely packed in insulated boxes and shipped via airfreight to our
Our manufacture has been in the electronics manufacturing market for
over 25 years, has a 60,000sqft warehouse in Shenzhen, China and employees 1200
workers.  I have conducted dealings with them several times in my previous
ventures (SuperSales Tag) (http://www.cbc.ca/player/Shows/Shows/Dragons'+Den/Pitches/ID/2383671247/?sort=MostRecent) and have been very impressed with their ability to meet deadlines
and conform to North American expectations.  Our current relationship is

and lightest integrated power bank battery case available today for
Galaxy S5. Designed to keep your phone fully protected and providing
extended battery life, this power bank battery case is slim enough to
easily fit into any pocket or handbag.This power bank battery case is
made especially for Galaxy S5 and provides enough charge to get you

through any busy day at the office or a night on the town.




Virtually double the battery life.
Take full advantage of everything your S5 has to offer - without
worrying about “down time.” Browse the web, download apps, send emails,

play games, enjoy music and watch videos.


Fully functional. Fully protected.
There’s no need to give up any features or functions, because the
Carbmetal case lets you easily access all of the Galaxy S5 controls and
keeps your ports, buttons, speakers, camera and flash free from

obstruction. 


Ease of use.
The battery cover is full of features designed with your ease of use in
mind. A standby switch lets you charge your phone only when you need it,
which maximizes time between recharges. You’ll never need to remove the

case!



Simultaneously charge your phone and Carbmetal casing
while syncing to your computer - and you can download photos and other
files from your phone, as well.
A four-light LED indicator on the back keeps tabs on how much battery
power is left. And, when it’s plugged in, the LEDs also keep you updated
on your power case charging status.

S5 Battery Case is manufactured using
carefully designed Small Pocket Holes for Heat Dissipation. Works as
both an external Phone battery charger and a protection case. On/Off
kick stand for Video Watching. Perfect cutouts allow access to all
cameras, microphones, sensors, and controls.

Carbmetal Special Charging Dock



Description:
Compatible with: Samsung Galaxy S5 i9600
This OTG charging dock is compatible with Samsung Galaxy S5
It will allow you to synchronize and charge your Galaxy S5 in one easy process.
Watch videos and listen to music while the handset charges.
It cradle will also provide a good angle for you to use the device.

It's built-in OTG function, allow you to connect external USB accessories.



Package includes:

1 x Micro USB Cable


Design Story

Developing cutting edge technology isn't easy, and it's also very
costly/time intensive. With your support, we can finally hit mass
production and meet the factory's minimum order quantities. We choose
our manufacturing partner based on their long track record of producing

high quality portable battery chargers.

Current Progress: We
already have fully functional versions of both the battery case and charging dock from our manufacturer overseas. The overall build is excellent

and identical to what would be the mass produced version.

Manufacturing Production Plan: A
large cash outlay is always required to start production. Plastic
molds, high quality battery cells and circuit boards need to be
purchased upfront. With the support of the Indiegogo community, we can

finalize our designs and start manufacturing.












Risk and Challenges

We have created
strong relationships with material and manufacturing partners. By
working closely with these partners, we’ll be able to cut down the cost
and also help ensure on-time delivery. Plus, we’re very lucky to have
the support of our family and friends to help us get the initial
prototypes engineered, built and tested, which allowed us to make big
improvements on the structure, design and electronics during the
prototype development stages. However, there are always challenges that
arise when manufacturing any hardware product. We see two main obstacles

we need to overcome.

One of the biggest challenges is the manufacturing process. Quality
control will be at the top of the list and most important issue. There
are many reasons why the manufacturer's cooperation will not be easy. We
understand that Indiegogo backers want their product as soon as

possible, but we are limited by factory's capabilities.


FAQ

I forgot to add shipping Charges when i pledge the product, how can i do so after that?
Simply Click 'Contribute Now', choose 'No perk, i just want to contribute' and add the shipping amount. We will keep track of it and promptly deliver your product. Don't worry! :)

Can Carbmetal Casing and dock work with other smartphones?
No. This particular product is only compatible with the 2014 Samsung Galaxy S5

Must I remove the existing back case to fit this product?
Yes. In order to retain the slickness and lightweight of the phone, you need to remove your original back
case first. Carbmetal case is a replacement for your original back case of the

phone.

When will Carbmetal ship?
We aim to ship out the first batch of Carbmetal Case early December. Depending on the volume of orders and location which you are in, actual shipping dates may vary. Carbmetal Team will keep you updated of the shipping date!

Is there a warranty for Carbmetal?
Yes, Carbmetal comes with a 6 months replacement warranty if it is due to manufacturing defects.

Can i get a refund if the product is faulty?
Yes. Simply drop us an email at carbmetal@hotmail.com and our customer service will attend to u. If the problem cannot be solved, you can send back the product and we will do an exchange for you.




Get additional $$ rewards and discounts simply by sharing it with your friends! How It Works

We’d
love to reward you and give you a Free Charging Dock and Power Casing for free-just for a few seconds to help spread the

word about our campaign.

Sign up on Indiegogo.com and you will be assigned your own ID number

Then click the Link button under the video to get your unique link to share online.  For example: http://igg.me/at/carbmetal/x/8538006 .  8538006 would be your unique ID number assigned by IG.


You can then share it with the message or post: 

Example:

If only all handphone casing are designed like this here: http://igg.me/at/carbmetal/x/8538006

Get a Free power casing of Samsung galaxy S5 here here: http://igg.me/at/carbmetal/x/8538006

Get a FREE charging dock of Samsung galaxy S5 here: http://igg.me/at/carbmetal/x/8538006

Don't forget to use YOUR LINK.

We
will then credit you $2 for each perk that is referred by you.  At the
end of the campaign, we will refund your Perk (if you contributed)
and/or notify you of the balance and you can spend it on whatever you

want from us.

That means when you pledge a $25 perk and you referred 25
people who also pledge the perks, you would get $25 refunded AND additional $25 to spend on a charging dock/casing, or anything else we offer here.  And that

would be for the Perk price instead of the retail price! 

Your help is appreciated!

We
would like to thank every backer for any contribution and any
assistance in the realization of our project. Please share our project

through Facebook and Twitter, we will be happy for any help!

If you have any questions or you just want to say hello, be sure to contact us at carbmetal@hotmail.com

phone. When will Carbmetal ship?We aim to ship out the first batch of Carbmetal Case early December. Depending on the volume of orders and location which you are in, actual shipping dates may vary. Carbmetal Team will keep you updated of the shipping date!Is there a warranty for Carbmetal?Yes, Carbmetal comes with a 6 months replacement warranty if it is due to manufacturing defects. Can i get a refund if the product is faulty?Yes. Simply drop us an email at carbmetal@hotmail.com and our customer service will attend to u. If the problem cannot be solved, you can send back the product and we will do an exchange for you.Get additional $$ rewards and discounts simply by sharing it with your friends! How It WorksWe’d
love to reward you and give you a Free Charging Dock and Power Casing for free-just for a few seconds to help spread the

word about our campaign. will then credit you $2 for each perk that is referred by you.  At the
end of the campaign, we will refund your Perk (if you contributed)
and/or notify you of the balance and you can spend it on whatever you
want from us.That means when you pledge a $25 perk and you referred 25
people who also pledge the perks, you would get $25 refunded AND additional $25 to spend on a charging dock/casing, or anything else we offer here.  And that
would be for the Perk price instead of the retail price! Your help is appreciated!We
would like to thank every backer for any contribution and any
assistance in the realization of our project. Please share our project
through Facebook and Twitter, we will be happy for any help!If you have any questions or you just want to say hello, be sure to contact us at carbmetal@hotmail.com",19.0,0,"1 Campaign
iGR has been providing market research and information to the wireless &
column2: mobile industry for the last 12 years. We need your help with a new project we call GlobalStats.

column1: GlobalStats is an iPad app that addresses one of the most fundamental problems industry professionals face today: Getting to data and stats quickly and efficiently. For research providers such as iGR, the issue is typically one of distribution. We have a great deal of data, forecasts and statistics that are valuable to the industry, but we have no way to deliver the data to a mobile device.  GlobalStats addresses this problem.

Our project is simple: Build the GlobalStats iPad app and provide updates to the information for 12 months.  GlobalStats will provide a new way to access survey data, market forecasts and other statistics quickly and easily.
We believe GlobalStats will be unique in the wireless &
column2: mobile research industry and will change how market research is delivered in the future.

column1: Our goal with GlobalStats is to build an iPad that is rich with data and information on the wireless and mobile communications industry. We want GlobalStats to be useful to a wide range of people in the industry, not just research professionals. So we expect many people to find value in the app, such as:

Sales: Imagine you are about to meet with an important client or prospect and need to know the number of smartphones in Latin America. Or how many LTE subscribers are in Japan.  A few clicks on GlobalStats will give the answers.
Public Relations: Need some stats for a press release? Or a client pitch? GlobalStats has the answers readily available.

Marketing: Need to put together a product presentation? Or a company marketing deck?  GlobalStats provides access to charts and stats for marketing presentations, outreach plans, media campaigns and content marketing.

Business Development: For those who want to understand the opportunity for specific markets, GlobalStats has a wealth of information.  From detailed market forecasts to end user views and opinions, GlobalStats provides important input to your data plan.
Engineering: Need to know how many consumers use iPhones vs. Android smartphones? Or how much mobile data bandwidth is consumed in Brazil? Or the forecast for VoLTE?  GlobalStats can help.
Before we start development of the GlobalStats app, we decided we needed to answer two questions for ourselves:

• Is there is real demand for an app like this? We think it is a great idea that meets a need we've identified. But, not everyone in the wireless and mobile industry may agree.  So, put simply, we do not want to build an app that only a few people will use. We need to make sure there is an audience.

• Are our price points for GlobalStats viable? Obviously, it will cost real dollars to build and maintain the app throughout 2013. So, we need investment to get the project (and product) off the ground. We have also built-in several perks that include access to the Globalstats app for up to 12 months.

To summarize, crowdfunding seemed like a good approach to take with the GlobalStats project. Early supporters will get not only access to a great app at a great price, but also the feel-good factor of knowing they started something new!
The image below is a mock up of the main page of the new GlobalStats app.  A few things to notice:
• The main sections of the app are listed along the bottom
• The 'Latest research' section shows new data and stats that have been added
• The map of the world will take you straight into the forecasts section
• The 'Keyword search' on the top right provides a search on all the data in the site for quick and easy navigation
The final layout/design may change when we get into development, but this is what we are aiming for. Simple, easy and fast access to the data you want!

'Survey Stats' gives you access to the large amount of survey data we have.  Today, we have no way to publish this outside of Excel or Powerpoint.  Using GlobalStats, we can provide easy, quick access to the large amount of data we have available.
The app presents the data available as a series of 'drill downs'.  The first level (below) shows the main subject areas on which we have data.  As we complete new surveys, we will add subject areas.

As an example, lets assume you have tapped on 'WiFi'.  The next level in the app will show you the data we have available on WiFi (below): consumer devices, movies watched, improvements, places, small-medium business use of WiFi, etc.
Again, as we collect new data, we will add to these choices.

Now, clicking on 'WiFi devices used in the Home' will bring up the actual survey data (below).  In this example, we are showing a bar chart with the WiFi devices consumers say they use at home.  Note that this data is from a May 2012 U.S. Consumer Survey of 1,024 respondents.

iGR conducts surveys throughout the year and in multiple countries around the world.  As well as consumers, we also survey small businesses and IT managers. The data from these surveys will be included as appropriate.
Note that NONE of the survey data from proprietary or custom research we conduct for clients will be included in GlobalStats.

'Summaries' allows the GlobalStats user to see executive summaries for iGR's research studies and briefs.  Navigation is similar to Survey Stats. The top level shows the main subject areas (see below). To date in 2012, iGR has published multiple research reports in the following subject areas:
• Small cells including femtocells, DAS and WiFi hotspots
• Video and music consumption on mobile networks
As new research is published, the executive summary will be available through GlobalStats.  iGR clients who have access to the full reports will be able to do so through GlobalStats.

The slide below shows an example of navigation in 'Summaries' - clicking on 'Smartphones' then shows the report subjects that are available.  Clicking on 'Android' then shows all of the reports that include Android smartphone data.
In this example, the U.S. Smartphone Forecast, 2011 - 2016, is selected - the executive summary is then displayed (below).

As you may expect, iGR publishes many different forecasts each year for markets around the world.  Putting these all in one place is a challenge that we can address with GlobalStats.  In the 'Forecasts' section of the app, we include all of our major forecasts for each region of the world.

The first slide below shows the top level global forecasts for Subscribers, Handsets, Smartphones, Tablets, Bandwidth consumed and WiFi Offload traffic, etc. Obviously, in the real GlobalStats app, the figures for the forecasts will be shown!

The navigation for this section is pretty cool: to drill down, you simply tap on the region of the world you are interested in.  In the example below, we have selected North America.  In the real app, the forecast data for this region would then be displayed below.
If data is available for a specific country (for example, the United States, Brazil, India, China), then that country can be selected and further forecasts are shown.  Easy!
As iGR updates its forecasts throughout the year, the data will be updated in GlobalStats as an update.  Similarly, if we add a new forecast, the new data will be added to the app.
GlobalStats includes several other areas that are also of value:

column2: this link will provide access to the content plus the ability to sign up.

column1: Client Area provides access to all of the published iGR research reports for our subscription service clients.
Video provides links to our video tutorials.

Obviously, a market research app is only as good as the data in it. GlobalStats is no different.  So to keep the app current and valuable, iGR will provide updates, new survey data and new forecasts throughout 2013.
We expect to provide updates weekly. Users will be notified that there is updated data in the app and, once they launch GlobalStats, they will have immediate access to the new information.
Where we're at and what we are going to do

Presently, we have built the demo and have developers scheduled to start work.  We expect to raise the funds we need in October and start development November 1st.  Delivery of the initial GlobalStats app will be in January 2013.
We will also load all of the data into the databases in November and December.  And of course, we will provide updated data and forecasts throughout 2013.
Will GlobalStats be available on the Apple iPhone?
Yes, but since the screen is so small, it will be hard to read the Summaries and Survey Stats.  Forecasts will be easier to read but we expect most usage will be on an iPad.
Will an Android or Windows version of GlobalStats be available?
Not initially, but this is something we are planning once the first version is up and running.
Once I buy GlobalStats, will I have to pay extra to access the data and forecasts?
No!  We are including access to all of the data and forecast in the price.  One payment gets access to it all!
Will the app be available for purchase after the Indigogo campaign ends?

Eventually, yes.  But initially we are focusing on delivering GlobalStats to the first supporters.  And, the price after the campaign will be higher. This is your chance to get in on the ground floor and benefit from very attractive early pricing!
Can I share my GlobalStats user ID with others?
Sorry, no.  Each user will only have access to GlobalStats on their own device. We will not support multiple users signing in with a single ID and password.
Can I access GlobalStats from multiple devices?
Yes, as a GlobalStats user you can access the app on multiple iPads and iPhones.  While access is supported from one device at a time, you can login from different devices as needed.
Can we get group access to GlobalStats?

Yes, we have several pricing packages that give discounts for multiple seats.  Each user will get their own ID and password.  All the users in a group must be in the same company or organization.

RasPoE is a Power over Ethernet (PoE) shield for Raspberry Pi B+ and Raspberry Pi 2. The shield allows you to use a single Ethernet cable to provide both data and power to your Raspberry Pi project. RasPoE is compliant with the  IEEE 802.3af standard, so you can use it with any standard PoE-capable switch or injector. 

RasPoE is fully open hardware -- the design files are published under GPL3. The
current design is available at https://github.com/ojousima/RaspberryPi-PoE. Design is done in KiCAD. We'll clear up the schematics and publish full parts list with distributors so you can even assemble your own boards if you want to! All this is still quite a lot of work, so please give us a few weeks to polish the design.

We'll work to merge the PCB footprints created for the board back to KiCAD
upstream during the campaign, your backing allows us to expand the common
Open framework for electronics design.

You can use RasPoE in all solutions where single-cable connectivity to your RasPi device would be A Good Thing. Do you want to get rid of wall warts? Get a standard Power over Ethernet enabled switch or an injector to provide power over your Ethernet cabling, and one RasPoE shield for each of your RasPi devices and voilá, no more ugly wall warts!
If providing separate power would be ugly or inconvenient, Power over Ethernet -- and RasPoE -- is your solution.
RasPoE is perfect for hanging RasPi based security cameras, WiFi hotspots or home automation gateways around your house.
Our board is very simple to use: Just plug it in, connect the cables and you're online!

The idea in PoE is to deliver both data and power using just one cable. Standard RJ45 cable has 8 data wires organized in 4 pairs. A 100MBit/s Ethernet signaling uses two of these pairs, some implementations of PoE use the remaining two pairs for delivering power. There are also implementations which carry the power with the data lines. Our board can receive power in either configuration, as required by the standard.

PoE is standardized (IEEE 802.3af and 802.3at) and allows for long distances (up to 100m). PoE is also widespread and affordable as there is an increasing number of PoE enabled switches in use. Standardized PoE is also safe as signaling allows the presence of a conformant device to be detected by the power source,  and allows the device and source to negotiate the amount of power required or available.

There are also non-standard implementations which connect the power to cable without the negation. This is dangerous, as Gigabit Ethernet uses all pairs in cable. If a non-standard PoE-equipment is used, connecting a powered cable to non-PoE equipment can cause damage to both devices.

Our board is IEEE 802.3af compliant class 0 device. It can deliver up to 6½ watts of power to Raspberry Pi and attached devices at 5 volts. Safety was one of the driving concerns in our design, we have included protection against over voltage and electrical transients. You and your Raspberry Pi are safe with our device.
In addition to our board, you will need a PoE-enabled switch or a midspan injector. We'll test several injectors and switches during the campaign and let you know our recommendations.
The production run of the boards has to be at least moderate to make the project economically feasible. Your funding allows us to buy the reels of components and pay for the assembly of the boards.

Our rewards are targeted to two different audiences: We offer single boards to makers who want to try their hand with home automation and Power over Ethernet. We're offering deals for distributors and companies who want to resell or adapt the boards for their own applications.

This is a fixed funding campaign, which means that if the funding is not reached we won't take any of your money. All the design files are available under GPL3, so you can still make your own boards and possibly tailor them to your needs.
You can find technical details of our board in our

We have done extensive planning and testing while developing the board.   Our first prototype was a model with some insulating tape required, second prototype revealed that we need to add some input protection. We are satisfied with our current design. The only risk remaining is whether we get enough orders to manufacture the boards in quantity.
The boards will be assembled in a professional assembly line and any manufacturing errors are covered by warranty.

We have gone through a few rounds of prototypes and the design has been tested and fine tuned to be convenient and reliable for everyday usage. In fact, we're streaming music to our desks with the prototype as we're typing this page.

The boards will be shipped directly to you from our manufacturer. We will cover at least the expense of normal shipping, and we will provide our EU customers with a receipt that shows the VAT for the items has already been paid in case customs asks for it. We cannot guarantee anything about what your local customs office might or might not decide to do, but if you have any trouble with customs clearance send us a message and we'll provide you with any paperwork we can.
If you like the idea, please spread the word. Ask your network infrastructure manager if the routers support PoE technology and suggest to have at least some PoE-capable spots installed.
Tell us about your projects and even product ideas, we're always interested in co-operation proposals for creating new connected devices.

ELL-i Co-operative is a young non-profit start-up. We are focusing on open source hardware and software designs for Internet of Things with emphasis on connectivity between the devices and cloud services. You can find more information about us at our website.

ELL-i has a proven track record of building PoE devices and applications. Our first design back in 2013 ""ELL-iduino"" was a standalone Power over Ethernet microcontroller platform. In 2014 we made a PoELL-i Nucleo, which is a Power over Ethernet shield for ST Nucleo boards.

We would like to thank the community and awesome support we have had ever since the beginning. Especially Vaasa's Hackerspace's contribution to us was extremely important, as they found out about the transient vulnerability in Ethernet PHY of Raspberry Pi. Open developing of the boards with the community let us find a critical design flaw, which is now fixed before our release. Even if our campaign is not successful, the knowledge we gained during this spring is now out in the open where everyone can benefit from it.

There has been a lot of interest in building derivative works based on our board. As we're committed to values of Open Source, we're always happy to see our designs grow into something else. Please contact us with your ideas and suggestions, even if it's just to let us know that you're making something cool. This way we can focus at something else at ELL-i and avoid duplicating work.

ELL-i has a proven track record of building PoE devices and applications. Our first design back in 2013 ""ELL-iduino"" was a standalone Power over Ethernet microcontroller platform. In 2014 we made a PoELL-i Nucleo, which is a Power over Ethernet shield for ST Nucleo boards.

We would like to thank the community and awesome support we have had ever since the beginning. Especially Vaasa's Hackerspace's contribution to us was extremely important, as they found out about the transient vulnerability in Ethernet PHY of Raspberry Pi. Open developing of the boards with the community let us find a critical design flaw, which is now fixed before our release. Even if our campaign is not successful, the knowledge we gained during this spring is now out in the open where everyone can benefit from it.

There has been a lot of interest in building derivative works based on our board. As we're committed to values of Open Source, we're always happy to see our designs grow into something else. Please contact us with your ideas and suggestions, even if it's just to let us know that you're making something cool. This way we can focus at something else at ELL-i and avoid duplicating work.",2.0,0,"2 Campaigns

Most of us spend the majority of our waking hours staring at a digital screen, just like your doing now and with the advancement of technology only becoming more inherently apart of our lives, the time we spend looking at our devices are increasing. Our eyes are paying the price.  
 


It’s taken roughly 365,000 years for our eyes to develop into the amazing mechanisms they are today, and its only taken our personal devices 35 years to evolve from a brick of a cell phone to pocket computers.

The pace at which technology is advancing is leaving our biological evolution in the dust and is taking a tremendous toll on our eyes in particular. 
So what exactly is the issue? 
Great question.  

Your body uses natural blue light from the sun to regulate your natural sleep and wake cycles. This is known as your circadian rhythm. Blue light also helps boost alertness, heighten reaction times and elevate moods. But the issue isn’t blue light from its natural source, it’s the artificial blue light that is generated by our devices that is the issue.  


Our eyes are not effective at filtering out blue light since blue light has a very short wavelength (380nm-470nm | 610–670 THz) and so produces a higher amount of energy. Virtually 100% of blue light travels through the cornea and into our retina. This is a bad thing since all other visible lights and their associated wavelengths are filtered through our eyes. Studies suggest that overexposure to blue light can cause our eyes long-term damage along with other negative side effects.   

Scientific studies reveal that switching to our 'night mode' setting is insufficient for protecting our eyes from blue light emission. The option to do so is available, but there is no major significance recorded.
 So not only do our screens default to an orange/pink filter that ruins the browsing experience but our eyes are still taking a hit. 

 

Screens are not going away any time soon. We’ve developed a solution to bring ease to our eyes.  

We've developed a mobile screen protector that will not only protect our eyes from the blue light waves emitted from our devices but also an impenetrable barrier to protect the crap out of your mobile screen. In other words, 2 in 1 has never looked or felt so good.  



 




With PURP's unique five-layer construction, your fingers and eyes will not know it's there when going about texting, picture taking, and everything and anything else you do with your device. We're strong believers that design is most beautiful when it's out of the user's way and PURP is just that.    




Our highest priority when designing PURP was providing protection without altering the feel of our devices. We're happy to say PURP in comparison with our competitors' blocks 90% of blue light emitted from our devices while allowing for maximum color and user transmittance (94%!). In other words, you will not notice PURP is applied onto your mobile device while its hard at work. Go on and enjoy your retina screen while you browse away :) 

br />
column2:
All of the many screens we tested dulled and over-tinted our devices. Tempered glass was thick and chunky. Plastic protectors were low quality with poor touch response.



 

As our personal devices advance further, it's important to recognize that developing technologies are incredibly new in relation to human evolution. We believe our tech should alleviate strain on the user by being used more mindfully and with better design. 

We're a small San Francisco-born startup focused on alleviating the strain around the tech gadgets we use through seamless design. We aim to create products that make a change for better health around our gadgets and making it the New Normal.

column4: >That's not all.  Can you also imagine a pair of earphones that is so comfortable that you could wear continuously for 8-12 hours a day?

column6: >IN-CUS is a wireless stereo earphones designed by a true long-time user.

column1: There are simply too many ""Me Too"" wireless earbuds, airpods, earpods, pearbuds, peabuds, wireless pods or whatever they name or calls it.

There is no real game changing technology in any of these.  The single biggest hurdle for over two decades in the wireless earphones arena from the mono single piece till the present stereo piece is still the same i.e. none other than the Voice Pick-up for call answering.

Yes, its about the MIC.  Nothing has changed much in this aspect except that it has gotten smaller and the deployment is more or less the same.  They are facing the same challenges of noise interference. Even with hardware and software noise cancelling technology it has improved but not significant enough to be any game changer.

I have a totally new idea that could create a new breakthrough in this aspect and a totally new game changer.  But that will be in a new chapter altogether.  If you are here to get some inspirations and ideas and wishes to get in touch, you may drop me a mail at incus.sg@gmail.com.

Why only settle for one, when you can have everything?

Mr. Everything is the all-in-one smart device charging station that includes additional features to keep you organized and prepared, no matter where life takes you! Mr. Everything includes charging capability for all of your smart devices (it can even jump your car battery!), LED lights, and even Bluetooth speakers to provide music wherever you go. Mr. Everything+ includes all of the Mr. Everything features with the added bonus of a universal AC power outlet.


Charging

 Mr.Everything meets all of your charging needs. With Qi standard wireless charging, rapid charging through 4 powerful USB ports (5V, 2100mA), and portable AC power outlet, you will never have to look for another power outlet ever again! With high quality Lithium-ion Polymer battery (3.7V, 26800mAh) you can charge your iphone 6 upto 15 times, and Macbook 2015 upto 2 times.


Power Outlet

Free yourself for power outlets! What do you do when your devices run out of juice and there is no power outlet to be seen? Mr.Everything is your answer. Built in power outlet on Mr.Everything provides up to 100W of power.


Speaker

You don't have to pay extraordinary price to enjoy extraordinary sound anymore! Mr.Everything provides robust bass, sharp treble with its 24W speakers. Sound that is comparable to other brand name speakers. The bottom of Mr.Everything is covered with silicon bumper that prevents shakes and unintended movements. Bluetooth 4.0 interface will provide you with uninterrupted sound and if you don't like hassle of bluetooth pairing, built in nfc chip will pair your device and Mr.Everything with a single touch. Mr.Everything will turn your surroundings into magnificient concert hall, great place for a party, or a place to listen to soothing music. The decision is yours to make.


LED Lights

Mr.Everything is accompanied by brilliant and colorful LED light that can be center of your party, It can also double as bedside lamp with its dimming feature, perfect companion for camping, fishing, any outdoor activities. It will be also a great helping hand in case of emergencies and blackouts.


Mr. Everything App

Mr.Everything is also smart. You can control Mr.Everything through buttons on the device and through the custom built app. On the app you can check the battery status, control lights, volume, power. The app will provide easy to use user experience and will be available to download freely on Itunes and google play store.


Your choice?


Specification

Battery

Lithium-ion Polymer Battery, 26800mAh at 3.7V

Fully charges from 0% in just 3.5 hours

Use Cases

Qbic: Your first wireless IoT speaker  

Qbic is your first bluetooh wireless speaker based on IoT (Internet of things) technology. It is not only a good speaker, but the integration of sensors and music. Qbic will change your lifestyle by connecting you to touchable music.

• Qbic is a very portable wireless speaker for your phone.
  • Qbic delivers great audio quality and solid design.
  • Qbic interacts with you by your gestures.

What is Qbic?

Qbic is awesome:

  • Qbic sings very clear and beautiful sound ever, even though it is a tiny mono cube in hands.
  • You can get your first bluetooth speaker controlled not only by your phone, but also by your gestures.
  • If this indiegogo campaign is succeeded, we will ship this terrific speaker in August, 2015.
You can move your Qbic and it responds your gestures:
• Rotate clockwise and counter-clockwise, then volume is up and down accordingly.
• Tilt your Qbic, then music is fast-forwarded or rewinded.
• When you need to mute Qbic, just turn it over on the table.
Qbic is a collaborated project with sound artisan who has golden ears and more than 20 years of sound expertise in Inkel and Samsung.
• Tiny Qbic's bass sound beats your stereo at home.
• It is comprises of an acoustic unit with subwoofer.
• It delivers 3W RMS, less than 5% THD, 80Hz~18KHz frequency response, and 6 hours of battery power.

Technology has evolved over time and it’s pretty hard to find any device around us not using software. As software evolves, people has realized that most important thing in developing software is to make better intuitive user experience.

Based on how product and service should be applied, our second most important thing is to connect everything intuitively. magicEco was founded for this purpose. We aim it by developing software platform that is capable of connecting things together, and that is scalable at the same time.

To build and enhance performances of our magicEco IoT platform, we put a lot of time and endeavor to invest in people. magicEco consists of experienced software engineers, hardware engineers, makers, and a creative designer. Talents at magicEco got great passion and expertise which is the fundamental skill sets to achieve one of valuable real-life IoT product in the planet.
Nameok Kim, Director of Hardware Team
