The USBand is the first USB Flash Drive hidden in a silicone bracelet designed to fit your wrist comfortably and with style! The USBand allows you to travel anywhere with your files easily available right on your wrist.  You will never again fumble looking for your USB flash drive in your bag, pockets, or leaving it behind somewhere.  The USBand is compatible with any USB port on your computer, speakers, car USB jacks, and many more.  You can tranfer your music, pictures, and files to your devices anywhere, anytime!
How We Came Up With Our Concept

As my business partner and I were sitting around for our daily coffee in the heart of Silicon Valley, we saw a women frustrated digging in her purse looking for something. Her laptop was out and as she was apparently looking for her USB flash drive to do some work. As her frustration grew, she was talking to herself wishing USB Flash drives are bigger and not so hard to find. At the same time, we saw a kid wearing a silicone band (representing his school logo), and my partner said to me, ""I just thought of something"" As I have heard that line so many times, and at this point it sounded like a broken record player, he suggested to combine the USB flash with a silicone bracelet so that it is easily accessible. At that time, I thought of it as nothing, and weeks later... we found ourselves researching this type of product. As months has gone by and a product like this was ""All Talk"" we decided to contact some of our sources to see if this is possible to combine. Reality came to us knowing that product will be useful out there in the world. We decided to fully pursue this with test phases and a budget design team (okay, I shall say we designed it ourselves), Today, we have the concept, the passion, but we are falling short on Tooling and Initial Production Run. That is why we are here on Indiegogo to help us get to the next level.

Flash Drives are commonly used in public space.  Often people forget them on the desk, leave them plugged in, or even drop them.  With the USBand you will not have that problem!  Wearing your USBand is like never forgetting your watch!

Your USBand can be used just like a conventional flash drive.  You just slide the USB Flash Drive out of the slot of the silicone bracelet and plug it into any USB port devices.  When you plug your USBand into the computer you will see the USB Flash drive pop-up or simply access the files on ""My Computer"".  Use your USBand to upload or download files and pretty much you are done!  You can access these files anywhere where USB access are available, from a computer or laptop to save your documents and files, vehicle audio systems to play music files, laptop for easy accessibility and portability, to a projector to show off your PowerPoint presentation or to share pictures and videos.

Workplace-  Work can be busy and hectic at times. With the USBand, you simply put it on and will always constantly have it on you. Searching, sending and saving work documents to access them is no longer necessary with the USBand. Put the USBand on like putting on your watch or grabbing your keys will save you from forgetting any of your work documents for that big presentation!

Schools- Your children's lives in school is full of homework, projects and extra curricular activities nowadays. Technology like laptops and USB Flash Drives are requirements for your child's education.  Students often forget or lose things because it's one more thing they have to remember. The USBand will help solve that problem. Putting on the USBand every morning like putting on their backpack will become an easy habit. Plus they can show off the amazing designs and colors to their friends and will have no more excuses not to turn in their homework!

Daily Use- People are expressive in the bands and bracelets to represent what they support in a charity, believes in life, or simply for company spirit.  The USBand is similar in style and can be personalized!  Imagine having all your music files on your USBand to plug in your car or office without utilizing any other devices. You can save photo files at anytime or on the go share videos and pictures with your friends and family members, all conveniently available on your wrist!

The USBand has lots of memory!  We are currently producing the 8GB of memory USBand.  We will be working with larger memory space with our Indiegogo funds which will allow an affordable price point for this product.

The great thing about the silicone material on our USBand is that the durability is tough not like the typical cheap ""rubber like"" materials.  The silicone is also odorless and kid safe. *Due to our manufactures privacy, sorry we could not provide pictures of the machinary that is used to make the bracelet.
Below are the moulding that is used to make the bracelet

There are three main parts to the USBand: SIlicon, PVC, Flash Memory and Design. Production for all three of these will come together in the final stage of shipping/assembly. Most importantly we want YOU to be a part of this process. We will be sending updates every step of the way.  On our website, we will be blogging, tracking, updating, and answering feedback/comments. We will also give you the opportunity for our most excited enthusiast to het their hands on pre-production units for review.  Your opinions and suggestions are always appreciated.

The great thing about the silicone material on our USBand is that the durability is tough not like the typical ""rubber like"" materials.  The silicone is odorless and kid safe.  The USBand can withstand a little a bit of water, not waterproof due to the opening for the flash drive, however you may wear it while washing your hands.  We do not recommend swimming with or submerge the USBand in water.

Your pledge (and again thank you SO much!) will help us bring this product to as many people as possible! We're trying to raise funding to help us cover the initial tooling costs so we can begin the expensive manufacturing process. Following over half a year of development and prototyping, sourcing and testing of materials, design pattern and building relationships with great vendors, our team is ready to put the USBand into production. This is where Indiegogo and people like YOU comes in to play. Design is complete and the manufacturing is ready to begin, but we need help funding the tooling, initial production run, gathering more designer for designs and marketing.
Basic- We feature 10 different colors of the bands.
""Inspirational"" Band- We can customize your band in any color!. Currently available are ""LOVE"" ""PEACE"" ""BELIEVE"" (not shown)

Matching Style- You can match these ""pairs"" together or pledge as a single unit.  The styles you see are what is available.  When our project funds, there will be many more styles for you to choose from!

column2: >Jimmy is a famous HK artist who revolutionizes dance, music, and fashion.  He has helped up design a band.  ""SRcrew"" is his dance group whom have won many competitions internationally.

column1: We are hoping to expand our line!  As the fashion market trends tends to fluctuate, we here at Doozy Inc. are always thinking of new ideas.  In the future we can CUSTOMIZE band prints to you personal preference.

The USBand is a great product for promotional items, gifts, company motivation, etc.  Doozy Inc. would like to talk to the sporting world such as the NBA, NFL, MLB, NHL just to name a few in regards about licensing their logo's and team names on the USBand.
Once we are funded, thanks to our supporters, we will work diligently to gather all your information so we can get the rewards shipped out as fast as we can!
*SHIPPING COST IS INCLUDED WITH PLEDGE AMOUNTS
International Shipping- PLEASE CONTACT US! PRICES VARIES DEPENDING ON REGION
Thank you for supporting us in this new innovation!  Please feel free to follow our updates at anytime!  We will do our best to update you with our amazing launch and Indiegogo rewards!
Our Website Doozy Inc (www.doozy-inc.com)
Again, we appreciate your pledges.  Every dollar counts to help us get launched.

The USBand is the first USB Flash Drive hidden in a silicone bracelet designed to fit your wrist comfortably and with style! The USBand allows you to travel anywhere with your files easily available right on your wrist.  You will never again fumble looking for your USB flash drive in your bag, pockets, or leaving it behind somewhere.  The USBand is compatible with any USB port on your computer, speakers, car USB jacks, and many more.  You can tranfer your music, pictures, and files to your devices anywhere, anytime!
How We Came Up With Our Concept

As my business partner and I were sitting around for our daily coffee in the heart of Silicon Valley, we saw a women frustrated digging in her purse looking for something. Her laptop was out and as she was apparently looking for her USB flash drive to do some work. As her frustration grew, she was talking to herself wishing USB Flash drives are bigger and not so hard to find. At the same time, we saw a kid wearing a silicone band (representing his school logo), and my partner said to me, ""I just thought of something"" As I have heard that line so many times, and at this point it sounded like a broken record player, he suggested to combine the USB flash with a silicone bracelet so that it is easily accessible. At that time, I thought of it as nothing, and weeks later... we found ourselves researching this type of product. As months has gone by and a product like this was ""All Talk"" we decided to contact some of our sources to see if this is possible to combine. Reality came to us knowing that product will be useful out there in the world. We decided to fully pursue this with test phases and a budget design team (okay, I shall say we designed it ourselves), Today, we have the concept, the passion, but we are falling short on Tooling and Initial Production Run. That is why we are here on Indiegogo to help us get to the next level.
Never Lose A Flash Drive Again!

Flash Drives are commonly used in public space.  Often people forget them on the desk, leave them plugged in, or even drop them.  With the USBand you will not have that problem!  Wearing your USBand is like never forgetting your watch!

Your USBand can be used just like a conventional flash drive.  You just slide the USB Flash Drive out of the slot of the silicone bracelet and plug it into any USB port devices.  When you plug your USBand into the computer you will see the USB Flash drive pop-up or simply access the files on ""My Computer"".  Use your USBand to upload or download files and pretty much you are done!  You can access these files anywhere where USB access are available, from a computer or laptop to save your documents and files, vehicle audio systems to play music files, laptop for easy accessibility and portability, to a projector to show off your PowerPoint presentation or to share pictures and videos.
What Are The Benefits Of USBand?

Workplace-  Work can be busy and hectic at times. With the USBand, you simply put it on and will always constantly have it on you. Searching, sending and saving work documents to access them is no longer necessary with the USBand. Put the USBand on like putting on your watch or grabbing your keys will save you from forgetting any of your work documents for that big presentation!

Schools- Your children's lives in school is full of homework, projects and extra curricular activities nowadays. Technology like laptops and USB Flash Drives are requirements for your child's education.  Students often forget or lose things because it's one more thing they have to remember. The USBand will help solve that problem. Putting on the USBand every morning like putting on their backpack will become an easy habit. Plus they can show off the amazing designs and colors to their friends and will have no more excuses not to turn in their homework!

Daily Use- People are expressive in the bands and bracelets to represent what they support in a charity, believes in life, or simply for company spirit.  The USBand is similar in style and can be personalized!  Imagine having all your music files on your USBand to plug in your car or office without utilizing any other devices. You can save photo files at anytime or on the go share videos and pictures with your friends and family members, all conveniently available on your wrist!

The USBand has lots of memory!  We are currently producing the 8GB of memory USBand.  We will be working with larger memory space with our Indiegogo funds which will allow an affordable price point for this product.
What is the USBand Made Of?

The great thing about the silicone material on our USBand is that the durability is tough not like the typical cheap ""rubber like"" materials.  The silicone is also odorless and kid safe. *Due to our manufactures privacy, sorry we could not provide pictures of the machinary that is used to make the bracelet.
Below are the moulding that is used to make the bracelet

There are three main parts to the USBand: SIlicon, PVC, Flash Memory and Design. Production for all three of these will come together in the final stage of shipping/assembly. Most importantly we want YOU to be a part of this process. We will be sending updates every step of the way.  On our website, we will be blogging, tracking, updating, and answering feedback/comments. We will also give you the opportunity for our most excited enthusiast to het their hands on pre-production units for review.  Your opinions and suggestions are always appreciated.

The great thing about the silicone material on our USBand is that the durability is tough not like the typical ""rubber like"" materials.  The silicone is odorless and kid safe.  The USBand can withstand a little a bit of water, not waterproof due to the opening for the flash drive, however you may wear it while washing your hands.  We do not recommend swimming with or submerge the USBand in water.

Following over half a year of development and prototyping, sourcing and testing of materials, design pattern and building relationships with great vendors, our team is ready to put the USBand into production. This is where Indiegogo and people like YOU comes in to play. Design is complete and the manufacturing is ready to begin, but we need help funding the tooling, initial production run, gathering more designer for designs and marketing.

Transform your home with the Viváve accent lighting system.  Thin and flat, the lights can hide in unexpected places and make a room come alive.

The difference a little color can make is stunning.  A simple splash of light can whisk you away to a peaceful oasis, or help get you pumped for the day if that's what you need. Spice up your kitchen when entertaining or relax in tranquil coziness in your bedroom.
The Viváve system is networked.  You control the lighting with your iPhone or web browser!
Adjust all your lights at once, or each light individually, you're in control.

And really, the whole point of having them networked is to be able to create smooth flowing color animations.  Fluid and peaceful flow for a calming effect, or dancing to the beat and harmony of your music, your room comes alive in color.
You'll never see a blank wall the same way again.
Viváve is bringing features found in gear that costs upwards of $2000 for a starting price of just $120 for a controller and one light.  Here comes affordable home automation!

Viváve was created by the artist/engineer Vim Venture.  Having many LED lighting projects under his belt, he originally made this system for his own home in his spare time.  The more his prototypes developed, the more excited he got about bringing this product to market.  And here it is in the home stretch!

Your Perk will put you in the cutting edge of home automation, starting with this beautiful accent lighting.  But beyond that, your contribution will create and sustain careers in the U.S.A.  With your help, the Viváve system can take this step in bringing innovative lighting designs to reality.  So many possibilities!
Bringing a product into production is expensive.  Meeting our minimum funding goal will let us deliver.  The funds go towards
• And of course, parts and labor for your lights and controllers!
We have manufacturing partners ready to go.  And as mentioned in the video, we want to manufacture here in the USA as volume and scheduling allows.
When our funding goal is met, you will be first to get the system up and running.  We've set up the perks for the campaign to let you help at whatever level you can.

When you have your lights beautifully illuminating your home and figure out that you would like to add more lights to your system, you'll be able to order more lights once all the founding Perks are delivered.  Pairing a new light to your controller is a simple process, the system is easily expandable.

And, this is just the beginning.  The lights in this launch are one of many planned additions to the Viváve system.  In the near future, you will be able to integrate white lighting, other types of accent lights, customized timing for lights on/off or scenes, DIY hardware additions, other apps through an API, you name it!
There's a reason why we paint things, they look great!  But color can also affect your mood, your focus, your blood pressure, much more.  We've all felt it at some point.  Take charge of your colors!
Repaint your rooms at home with light.  Every night, for every mood.

The Viváve project is being led by Vim Venture.  Vim, who holds a Ph.D. in Applied Physics, is an engineer, artist, technophile.  He has been creating technology and LED based art and creative products for years.  Check out the iPhone app ""Leaves"" from ThreeVee Software or the Digital Light Studio mentioned in the video.
Please help spread the word!  Don't be a fink, share the link.

The making of the Quasar IV is a project that is designed to reinstate
personal liberty to the internet.  Based
on the world's most advanced security concepts and a trusted-authentication
technology, it allows users to self-manage their digital interactions and
The Quasar IV will be production ready in March 2014 and
available to the general public in June 2014. Indiegogo backers will receive
the Quasar IV in April 2014. The Quasar IV offers the following key features:
• Unique digital signature and key computation methodology to protect your
3GB RAM, 64/128GB encrypted local storage and 128GB encrypted cloud storage
The Quasar IV is a “cipherphone” that safeguards the
user’s digital identity with self-authenticated verification. All data
exchanges between Quasar IVs are protected by trusted-authentication technology.
The Quasar IV is your gateway to a community of secure messages, emails,
calls, cloud storage and mobile applications:
IV uses a revolutionary self-authenticated, asymmetric encryption system called
Quatrix that automatically verifies the identity of other Quasar IV users
before information is sent. Your private identity key is encrypted in a
hardware chip, making unauthorized access to data extremely difficult.
• Secure Operating System: QuaOS, Quasar IV’s operating system, is a fusion
of Android, Linux and the Quatrix encryption software. The Quasar IV provides unprecedented
• Open Ecosystem for Developers: QSAlpha provides a software development kit (SDK) that
allows software developers to build secure applications.
IV users receive the most complete protection when communicating with other
Over the last five years, more than 27 million Americans
have fallen prey to identity theft and 73 percent have suffered from
cybercrime. Americans lose over $20 billion to identity theft each year. In
2012 alone, the Identity Theft Resource Center documented 447 major security
breaches in the US that left 17 million personal records exposed to criminal
their mobile devices to handle e-commerce transactions, day-to-day banking,
storage of sensitive personal information or just casual correspondence.

Quasar IV offers protection against external threats to enterprise and personal users of digital networks.
Publicly available statistics about the extent of
cybercrime make clear that conventional computers and smartphones fail to
prevent security breaches. The Quasar IV prevents identity theft and data leaks
by using Quatrix, a proprietary encryption logic based on advanced trusted-authentication

On a standard smartphone, when you text, email, call and store files, each service must verify who you are, so they provide you with a public key that is stored online. Every time you use each service, this public key confirms your identity.
Because public keys have to be stored and authenticated online by a third party server, your identity could be vulnerable to intrusion attacks.
No matter how complicated your passwords are, intruders

can still impersonate your digital identity if they infiltrate and take control of the authentication server. Your lost digital identity may be used for cyber-crime. Until now, we’ve been relying on third-party agencies to authenticate and protect our most valuable information.
when you text, email, call and store files within Quatrix, you and your
contacts are authenticated via a public seed matrix located locally in the

Quasar IV’s Quatrix hardware chip. This occurs offline, on each phone. The seed public matrix is simply a mediator that helps Quatrix devices verify each other’s identities through computation rather than exchange.
Verification happens on your device, not a public server
developed a methodology to create up to 10^77 public and private key pairs from 16^16^4 three-dimensional matrices. By storing the possible encrypted
combinations on the device, it becomes extremely difficult to forge your
digital identity. On top of this, access to the Quasar IV’s secure apps
requires both an 8+ digit PIN and a Two-Man Rule login.
Essentially, QSAlpha has engineered a way to safely
authenticate users in the digital world without incurring massive
infrastructure costs. We’ve created a mathematically engineered matrix that

contains all possible combinations of identity keys and then issued it to each individual user encoded in hardware. Truly safe identity verification must mimic the methods of real world, through offline communication security, and Quatrix does exactly that.

Quatrix Trusted-Authentication Flow
In April 2011, The White House issued the National Strategy for Trusted Identities in Cyberspace.The goal was to encourage the
development of security infrastructure that would allow people to validate
The Quatrix solution goes beyond the The White House vision and also
addresses the requirements of the “Future Network.”
Network,” a program of the ITU
(International Telecommunication Union)’s SG13 (Study Group 13) on standards
for next generation networks (NGN), guided the security principles behind the Quasar IV’s self-authenticated and encryption technology.
“Future Network” endorses trusted identity authentication security, the basis of Quatrix.
The Quatrix system is based on asymmetric encryption, which includes three function modules: Key Generation, Authentication (Signature Verification) and Data Encryption.
The key generation and distribution structure is the
base of the Quatrix System. The private and public keys are generated separately: the private key is generated by the Key Management Center
(KMC), while the public key is generated by the user.
Signature verification and data encryption are performed
using the Quatrix Key System. Since the public key is generated on the user
side, the two operations are performed in peer-to-peer manner, and no online

""A lot of the nightmares we face in the information security and privacy industry include aspects like cryptographic key management, trusted identity, and an overall fragility in the hardware devices that we use. QSAlpha's Quatrix system and the Quasar IV cipherphone's strategy of securing both the software and hardware is the approach that's needed for a trusted computing environment.""
It is not safe to entrust one company, corporation or
entity with the protection of your personal data. QuaOS is a fusion of Android,
Linux and the Quatrix trusted-authentication technology to create the world’s
first mobile OS that utilizes self-authenticated logic to safeguard your
communication and data-sharing. Storing the private seed matrix offline and
providing the user with the hardware encoded key pairings gives the user
control over security, rather than any one corporation or entity.
Using Quasar IV with QuaOS means that you are in control of your own data and you are able to safeguard your own digital identity.
developers. Quasar IV offers developers access to the core source code to
encourage the creation of a completely open yet secure application ecosystem.
QuaOS offers developers the opportunity to create a vast
range of data-encrypted applications which, in time, will be able to leverage a
trusted community of Quasar IV owners.

The Quasar IV not only reflects the covertness of a ninja, but also the

Simple but effective, subtle yet powerful, functional
but graceful, the Quasar IV gives the user an indelible sense of being on a
mission. It is the shadow of people who move about with a purpose.

Collective noun for members of the Quatrix ecosystem.
Cipherphone Designed To Protect Your Digital Identity.
The making of the Quasar IV is a project that is designed to reinstate
personal liberty to the internet.  Based
on the world's most advanced security concepts and a trusted-authentication
technology, it allows users to self-manage their digital interactions and
The Quasar IV will be production ready in March 2014 and
available to the general public in June 2014. Indiegogo backers will receive
the Quasar IV in April 2014. The Quasar IV offers the following key features:
• Unique digital signature and key computation methodology to protect your
3GB RAM, 64/128GB encrypted local storage and 128GB encrypted cloud storage
The Quasar IV is a “cipherphone” that safeguards the
user’s digital identity with self-authenticated verification. All data
exchanges between Quasar IVs are protected by trusted-authentication technology.
The Quasar IV is your gateway to a community of secure messages, emails,
calls, cloud storage and mobile applications:
IV uses a revolutionary self-authenticated, asymmetric encryption system called
Quatrix that automatically verifies the identity of other Quasar IV users
before information is sent. Your private identity key is encrypted in a
hardware chip, making unauthorized access to data extremely difficult.
• Secure Operating System: QuaOS, Quasar IV’s operating system, is a fusion
of Android, Linux and the Quatrix encryption software. The Quasar IV provides unprecedented
• Open Ecosystem for Developers: QSAlpha provides a software development kit (SDK) that
allows software developers to build secure applications.
IV users receive the most complete protection when communicating with other
Over the last five years, more than 27 million Americans
have fallen prey to identity theft and 73 percent have suffered from
cybercrime. Americans lose over $20 billion to identity theft each year. In
2012 alone, the Identity Theft Resource Center documented 447 major security
breaches in the US that left 17 million personal records exposed to criminal
Quasar IV has been designed for:
their mobile devices to handle e-commerce transactions, day-to-day banking,
storage of sensitive personal information or just casual correspondence.
privacy and peace of mind and would like to ensure that their private
to ensure that eavesdroppers and stalkers cannot track their every move in the
data security and want to ensure that communications between executives,
employees, customers and others cannot be read or listened to by third parties.
Quasar IV offers protection against external threats to enterprise and personal users of digital networks.
Publicly available statistics about the extent of
cybercrime make clear that conventional computers and smartphones fail to
prevent security breaches. The Quasar IV prevents identity theft and data leaks
by using Quatrix, a proprietary encryption logic based on advanced trusted-authentication

On a standard smartphone, when you text, email, call and store files, each service must verify who you are, so they provide you with a public key that is stored online. Every time you use each service, this public key confirms your identity.
Because public keys have to be stored and authenticated online by a third party server, your identity could be vulnerable to intrusion attacks.
No matter how complicated your passwords are, intruders

can still impersonate your digital identity if they infiltrate and take control of the authentication server. Your lost digital identity may be used for cyber-crime. Until now, we’ve been relying on third-party agencies to authenticate and protect our most valuable information.
when you text, email, call and store files within Quatrix, you and your
contacts are authenticated via a public seed matrix located locally in the

Quasar IV’s Quatrix hardware chip. This occurs offline, on each phone. The seed public matrix is simply a mediator that helps Quatrix devices verify each other’s identities through computation rather than exchange.
Verification happens on your device, not a public server
By using state-of-the-art cryptography, we have
developed a methodology to create up to 10^77 public and private key pairs from 16^16^4 three-dimensional matrices. By storing the possible encrypted
combinations on the device, it becomes extremely difficult to forge your
digital identity. On top of this, access to the Quasar IV’s secure apps
requires both an 8+ digit PIN and a Two-Man Rule login.
Essentially, QSAlpha has engineered a way to safely
authenticate users in the digital world without incurring massive
infrastructure costs. We’ve created a mathematically engineered matrix that

contains all possible combinations of identity keys and then issued it to each individual user encoded in hardware. Truly safe identity verification must mimic the methods of real world, through offline communication security, and Quatrix does exactly that.Quatrix Trusted-Authentication Flow
In April 2011, The White House issued the National Strategy for Trusted Identities in Cyberspace.The goal was to encourage the
development of security infrastructure that would allow people to validate
The Quatrix solution goes beyond the The White House vision and also
addresses the requirements of the “Future Network.”
Network,” a program of the ITU
(International Telecommunication Union)’s SG13 (Study Group 13) on standards
for next generation networks (NGN), guided the security principles behind the Quasar IV’s self-authenticated and encryption technology.
“Future Network” endorses trusted identity authentication security, the basis of Quatrix.
The Quatrix system is based on asymmetric encryption, which includes three function modules: Key Generation, Authentication (Signature Verification) and Data Encryption.
The key generation and distribution structure is the
base of the Quatrix System. The private and public keys are generated separately: the private key is generated by the Key Management Center
(KMC), while the public key is generated by the user.
Signature verification and data encryption are performed
using the Quatrix Key System. Since the public key is generated on the user
side, the two operations are performed in peer-to-peer manner, and no online

A lot of the nightmares we face in the information security and privacy industry include aspects like cryptographic key management, trusted identity, and an overall fragility in the hardware devices that we use. QSAlpha's Quatrix system and the Quasar IV cipherphone's strategy of securing both the software and hardware is the approach that's needed for a trusted computing environment.""
An Independent Security And Privacy Researcher
It is not safe to entrust one company, corporation or
entity with the protection of your personal data. QuaOS is a fusion of Android,
Linux and the Quatrix trusted-authentication technology to create the world’s
first mobile OS that utilizes self-authenticated logic to safeguard your
communication and data-sharing. Storing the private seed matrix offline and
providing the user with the hardware encoded key pairings gives the user
control over security, rather than any one corporation or entity.
Using Quasar IV with QuaOS means that you are in control of your own data and you are able to safeguard your own digital identity.
QSAlpha will actively promote innovation among
developers. Quasar IV offers developers access to the core source code to
encourage the creation of a completely open yet secure application ecosystem.
QuaOS offers developers the opportunity to create a vast
range of data-encrypted applications which, in time, will be able to leverage a
trusted community of Quasar IV owners.
We took our design inspiration from one of the world’s
most recognized symbols of secrecy, supernatural ability and stealth: the art
In the digital world, privacy and security have been
impossible to attain until now, which is why we found our inspiration in a
warrior who does the impossible. We created a device that allows users to send
data undetected across the rooftops and through the alleyways of cyberspace.
The Quasar IV not only reflects the covertness of a ninja, but also the
extraordinary grace, flexibility and subtlety of this iconic figure.
Simple but effective, subtle yet powerful, functional
but graceful, the Quasar IV gives the user an indelible sense of being on a
mission. It is the shadow of people who move about with a purpose.
The way of Ninjutsu inspired the way of the ultimate
The Quasar IV is the world’s first cipherphone tailored
to secure privacy.  The device has been named Quasar IV because the IV
stands for Identity Vessel, and because the fourth amendment of the US
constitution guarantees the right to privacy.
The Quasar IV combines a suite of encrypted applications
and the ability to safeguard personal information with features we commonly
associate with smartphones: fast processors, onboard memory, sensors, front and
Most importantly, it opens up a new world to the
developer community by providing a system that protects applications, content
We’ve spent the last three years developing and
integrating the security and smartphone technologies to the point where we now
have the design finalized, along with the latest working prototypes. The scope
of design work that has been completed includes the following:
of Secure Applications by Third Party Developers
We now look to you to get the Quasar IV into the final
phase of testing and production. We are crowdsourcing USD $3,200,000 dollars to
take us from our current stage to manufacturing the first 10,000 units. If we
exceed our target, we will be able to increase the first manufacturing run.
The Quasar IV 64GB edition will be retailed for $785 but
is available to backers for only $595 and the Quasar IV 128GB edition will be
retailed for $855 but is available to backers for only $665. As soon as the
campaign starts, we are offering the first 950 units of Quasar IV 64GB for just
$495. Of course, we also offer a wide range of other rewards for different
We hope you will support our aim of becoming the first
company to offer a solution to one of the digital era’s greatest problems.
The QSAlpha team members include internationally
recognized pioneers in digital security, communications and augmented reality.
The team has extensive experience and relations with some of the world’s best
manufacturer and components providers in the smartphone industry. With QSα, we aim to create the world’s
safest digital community. The team’s head office is based in San Francisco,
USA. To provide immediate access and closer working relationships with our
manufacturing and design partners, we have based our QSAlpha project team in
Taiwan. We also have offices in North Carolina and UK.

If our Indiegogo campaign is successful, we will use the

""I like it! ... Real dudes (and some gals I know) will love the TekTuk :)""  -Adam Curry of The Podfather, Daily Source Code, No Agenda, and Headbangers Ball
""Looks neat!""  -Amber MacArthur of CommandN and TWiT.tv
""TekTuk looks awesome.  I totally need something like this!""  -Drew Domkus of The Dawn &
""Something you've always needed, but didn't know it until now.""  -The Garden of Evil
""Excellent idea and product.  I'm glad to back it and I'll be even gladder to use it.""  -Some Dude from Belfast, UK
""I thought you hadn't begun building them yet ...?""  -Dr. Macenstein
Convenient bedside storage and charging for all of your idevices and accessories.
That mangled mess of cables, earphones, remotes, and your iPad® and iPhone® will be a thing of the past
Cell phone pocket - This pocket will accommodate any cell phone on the market up to 3 1/4"" wide and 1"" thick.
Tablet computer pocket - You can fit any tablet, netbook, or mini laptop up to 11"" wide and 1"" thick in this pocket.
Accessory pocket - Easily store your power and charging cords, earplugs, iPods, mice, etc. in this spacious 7"" wide, 4 1/2"" tall zippered pocket.
Magazine and document pocket - When you are en route to your next bed, store your magazine or boarding pass in the elastic document pocket.  ⬇
No more fumbling for charging or syncing cords.  When you need one, just grap it from the elastic cord management loop and plug in your device.  ⬇
After 10 months of designing and trying out 6 prototypes, we've come up with a product that will look great hanging from your bed, and make you look great carrying it.  ⬇
I MUST HAVE A TEKTUK™!  When will I get it?
Our goal is to get our investors their TekTuk™ by Christmas.  According to our Gantt chart, it will be a tight squeeze
column2: but I think we can do it!  In order to make this more probable, we will be sending out the first batch of TekTuks without retail packaging and in the order they are bought.  The distributor packs, with full retail packaging, will be sent out after all other orders have been fulfilled.

column1: The faster we reach our goal, the faster we can start production.  So if you want a TekTuk under your Christmas tree, don't wait until the last minute to donate!
Where will all of the raised funds go?
Your investment dollars will help us with:
If we raise more than our goal, that money will go toward:
• Booth space at trade shows like MacWorld™ and CES™, to spread the word.
• Development cost for our next product:  TekTuk mini™
Important:  This is an all-or-nothing campaign!  If we don't reach our goal

column1: Bob Wilson, mechanical engineering University of Kentucky, had a childhood dream of inventing a perpetual motion machine which culminated in:
After he finished his 7th prototype, Bob needed to find someone with the technical and legal expertise to complement his skill sets.

Greg earned his B.S. in Electrical Engineering, summa cum laude, and M.S. in Computer Networking at North Carolina State University and his J.D. with honors at the University of North Carolina School of Law. He worked at IBM Corporation in network interface adapter testing and design prior to attending law school.
The 9th prototype was ultimately built, patent filed, and patent awarded.
We wanted to achieve the dream of equipping the iPhone 5 with a full size keyboard with keys that feel like full size keys.
Our patented technology builds into a hard shell iPhone 5 DREAM KEYBOARD Case a wireless full size keyboard with keys that feel like full size keys.

• You get versatility:  Because we give you 2 keyboards, you choose whether you want to use Apple’s virtual keyboard for thumb typing in handheld mode or our built-in full size keyboard for 10 finger typing in desktop mode.
You get convenience:  Now, wherever you happen to be -- boardroom, classroom,  coffee house -- you have the complete functionality of desktop typing available to you.
How do we describe the iPhone 5 Dream Keyboard Case?

The iPhone 5 Dream Keyboard Case needs no instruction manual (as soon as you slide the iPhone 5 into our case, you know what to do).  The Dream Keyboard Case uses 2 different types of keyboards and is designed for business people, professionals, and students. They want the ultimate case which converts their iPhone 5 to either a handheld device with Apple’s virtual keyboard for thumb typing or to a desktop device when there’s a lot of typing to do and they need a full size keyboard for greater productivity.
• We built and tested 9 prototypes with dummy keys.
We were awarded a patent for our technology.
Because we do not have a working prototype, we need capital to build 2,000 working prototypes for testing.
• We want 2,000 contributors willing to contribute $70.00 each and willing to test the 2,000 working prototypes.
How do we plan to manufacture and market the Dream Keyboard Case?
After we get funding, we will seek to partner with Logitech and Sprint to manufacture and market the Dream Keyboard Case.
Then we will ask our contributors for suggestions on who else to pick to manufacture and market our technology.
Doesn’t this mean risk to our contributors?
Yes.  If you do not believe we have breakthrough technology, then please do not become a contributor.
What is the projected date of the 2,000 Dream Keyboard Case WORKING PROTOTYPE release?
• We chose a release date of March 2013 that we knew we could easily meet.
We will post the exact date as soon as we know.
What happens if there are more than 2,000 contributors?
• The first group of 2,000 contributors get to keep the WORKING PROTOTYPE as their PERK.
The second group of contributors get as their PERK a 25% discount on the Dream Keyboard Case when released.
Do you have to be a Sprint iPhone 5 user to get PERKS?
Do you have to be a Sprint iPhone 5 user to BUY the Dream Keyboard Case after the 60 day Indiegogo campaign ends?
Why are we giving an exclusive to Sprint?
How will the Dream Keyboard Case be sold outside the US market?
• We will post an answer as soon as we know.

Do you have to be a Sprint iPhone 5 user to BUY the Dream Keyboard Case after the 60 day Indiegogo campaign ends?
Why are we giving an exclusive to Sprint?
How will the Dream Keyboard Case be sold outside the US market?

Hello, my name is Andrei Socivoi I'm the inventor of the Snap On Case. I'm the type of person that always try to invent something and always open stuff to see who they work and try to improve them. And i make all my prototype by hand and at home from product that are all ready on the market, open them up and combining them...

The Snap On Case beside being very simple idea it is very versatile phone case. The case can be used as a bracelet, vertical kickstand, horizontal kickstand, hands free stand, it can be attach to a lot of objects like ""street light pol"" for video and picture taking :) , ""street bench"" for video and picture taking, dash board in your car for GPS usage and many more that i didn't find out yet. Plus is a fun thing to play with.
I have working prototypes, i field for a Patent and now i have a Patent Pending Status on the Snap On case. I have contacted a factory and i got a estimate price on the molds and on the cases.

I need $20.000 to make this project come to life, the money will be used to make the tow molds that i need to make the case, one of the molds will be for the silicon part of the case and the other molds will be for the plastic side of the case.
I got a estimate price for the molds, for the silicon molds a got a estimate of $3,000 and for the plastic mold a estimate of $5,000 but i round it up to $10,000 just to be in the save side.
I have to be able to make the minimum required order of 5.000 units.
Plus i will personally go to the factory and inspect the quality of the cases.
In order to make this happen i will need $20.000 which will cover all the cost.
Provisional Patent Application field to and received by the U.S. Commissioner for patents office.

""Savtale"" means ""grandma"" in the biblic language, Hebrew.
We collected hundreds of tips from our grandma's along the years and put them all in one website.
As per request of many visitors, we developed an iPhone app, raising money from our family and giving some of our own.
Now, many visitors suggested we will do the same for Android but we found it too hard to raise more money again :(
So we are here, asking you to help us in this great cause.
The app is totally free, just like the iPhone app (Home.Remedies) and we plan to keep it that way.
Our only incentive here is to asisst others and keep the world green, use only natural stuff and keep our health and youth.
The cost of developing the Android app (including design, a bit of marketing, QA and English writing here and there) is $30,000.
We already paid $5,000 as a first phase payment so it's already running and we will find a way to do this, one way or another.
We will really appreciate your help and will send you a link to install the app, a month before we will release it in ""Play"" (aka: Android Market).
This way, we can get your feedbacks and use you as testers as well :)

Even if you can't contribue money-matters, you can still help in other ways like: recommend more tips from your own grandma's, fixing our English writing errors, QA our app and suggest on more cool stuff to the app.
Savtale"" means ""grandma"" in the biblic language, Hebrew.
We collected hundreds of tips from our grandma's along the years and put them all in one website.
As per request of many visitors, we developed an iPhone app, raising money from our family and giving some of our own.
Now, many visitors suggested we will do the same for Android but we found it too hard to raise more money again :(
So we are here, asking you to help us in this great cause.
The app is totally free, just like the iPhone app (Home.Remedies) and we plan to keep it that way.
Our only incentive here is to asisst others and keep the world green, use only natural stuff and keep our health and youth.
What We Need & What You Get
The cost of developing the Android app (including design, a bit of marketing, QA and English writing here and there) is $30,000.
We already paid $5,000 as a first phase payment so it's already running and we will find a way to do this, one way or another.
We will really appreciate your help and will send you a link to install the app, a month before we will release it in ""Play"" (aka: Android Market).
This way, we can get your feedbacks and use you as testers as well :)

Even if you can't contribue money-matters, you can still help in other ways like: recommend more tips from your own grandma's, fixing our English writing errors, QA our app and suggest on more cool stuff to the app.

column4: >We are proud here to present Burstvision Smart Glass: a wearable technology as amazing as  Google Glass but of high quality-price ratio. Its compelling applications will make your life easier, full of fun, and shareable anywhere anytime.

column7:
>

Two types of Burstvision are available:  Burstvision Optical Glass and Burstvision Sunglass.

The frames are light and durable. For Optical Glass, the non-prescription lenses can be replaced with prescription ones with the help of eye-care service providers.

BurstVision Sunglass looks absolutely aesthestic at no cost of function.

We are based in the city of Shenzhen, known as China's Silicon Valley.  Our team, with over a decade of experience in electronics
of eletronic products. We specialize in mobile phone and related products,  being among
those in Shenzhen who were the earliest to engage in research and development projects related to
Android-based mobile phone. As the glass and mobile phone
are quite similar devices in terms of software and hardware systems, our previous experience and resource has put us at an advantagous position in developing Burstvision Glass.

column1: (Notes: Lenses of Burstvision Sunglass in the picture above are of earlier version. The tint of latest
version is lighter, providing a brighter view .)
What software development kit is needed in making apps for it?
Only an android-based standard SDK will do in developing the apps. No special SDK is needed. When necessary, we will be considering to develop SDK specifically applied to the glass.
What is important in programming for the device?

The important thing is to improve the user hands-free experience by making full use of such technologies as accelerometer, somatosensory operation (nodding, shaking head etc) and voice recognition input.

column5: >It is water-resistent to some degree, but not waterproof. Hopefully, the product will be increasingly water-resistant, as we are working hard to make it happen.

column1: Yes, they can, but only in the frame of BurstVision Optical. Prescription lenses can be installed with the help of eye-care providers.
How long would the battery last after each charge?

column5: >A full single charge would make the battery last between 1 and 4 hours,  The running time depends on how old the battery is and what you are doing with the glass. For example, the battery would last around 1 hour for video-recording .

column1: Like many other android-based devices, it is safe to charge the glass through the standard USB port on a computer or laptop.  A 3rd party charger can also be used, but its safty or risk involved is beyond our control and liability.
What version of Android system is Burstvision based on?
Burstvision is currently based on Android 4.2. We are working to upgrade it to 4.4. We will be making the upgrade tool available to all users when it is ready.
What advantages does Burstvision have compared to Google Glass?

Well, Burstvision is a product of high quality-price ratio. It offers all essential features as Google does but only at a fraction of the latter's price. Burstvision is also open to other andriod-based applications, which the user can install/develop on their own. We will continue to develop more sophisticated applications.
Can this smart glass be used to make phone call or send/receive message?
We are still working on an app to enable BurstVision to do so through an android phone, like Google Glass does.

How long would the battery last after each charge?

A full single charge would make the battery last between 1 and 4 hours,  The running time depends on how old the battery is and what you are doing with the glass. For example, the battery would last around 1 hour for video-recording .

Like many other android-based devices, it is safe to charge the glass through the standard USB port on a computer or laptop.  A 3rd party charger can also be used, but its safty or risk involved is beyond our control and liability.

We created the first OwnFone four years ago and the fully customisable, incredibly easy to use voice only mobile phone was an instant hit!
We managed to provide over 10,000 people with a really simple way to communicate with their loved ones - everyone loved it!

So we decided to think about how we could make it even better.  We wanted to keep the really flexible design, it had to be super easy to use just like before, but we wanted to add lots of background features that would significantly enhance its value to you and your family.

Features like GPS tracking to alert you when things aren't right, making it waterproof to protect against unexpected accidents and the ability to send information on the devices current status.  We also wanted to make it as future proof as currently possible, so we are adding 3G &
column2: 4G, Bluetooth, Wi-Fi and GPS!  We will have a built in service which prevents anyone other than pre-approved callers from the calling - no more cold callers!!!

column1: All this extra functionality means that we can start to think about adding medical sensors in the future, home sensors where someone might not necessarily have home broadband and much much more!
To summarise, the OwnFone is the simplest, but most effective way of enabling anyone to communicate!
So we are pleased to present the all new OwnFone!  This new device will feature everything that you loved in the old device, with the added benefits listed above.
You will be able to make and receive calls in an ultra easy one touch way, via 2G, 3G &
column2: 4G.  Find out where the device is via the ultra easy iOS &amp
column3: Android app, but also via a normal PC or Mac browser.  All of this is powered by the market leading Anywhere Sim.  In the future, the device will also be able to interact with Bluetooth devices, either wearable devices, or even in home monitors like smoke alarms or connected thermostats.

column1: We want to make this device the main connectivity platform in your loved ones home, especially where there is no existing broadband.
To enable us to produce the new OwnFone, we have a target of £250,000.  This will enable us to deliver the all-new OwnFone along with the new Android &
• There is a portion of the funding required for the certification of the device.
• We need to finalise the internal device architecture.
• Finish the new device tooling and confirm final specification of the apps.
• Carry out all the necessary testing and confirm final design.
We have to hit our financial target to get started, so we have created some attractively priced perks to encourage you to help us on our way!
• There are five perks and they range from 25% off to 15% off.
• They all include everything you will need for 12 months, including the industry leading multi network Anywhere Sim!

The new OwnFone removes any barriers to adopting mobile technology by removing all the complexity normally associated with mobile phones.  Our devices are transforming how people communicate already, but with the new device we can start to develop all kinds of new ways of caring for our loved ones and helping to maintain their independence for as long as possible.

We already have a tried and tested external design for the OwnFone, so the main challenge for us is fitting the extra functionality inside the existing device housing.  We are confident we can, but it may be necessary to make the device slightly thicker.  We will also be keeping a very close eye on the battery performance to make sure the device maintains its attractive lifespan.
Other than that, we are absolutely confident we can deliver the finished product within the target!

We understand that not everyone has a requirement for the new device, but almost everyone knows someone who could really benefit from it.  We want to spread the word as far and wide as possible, this device can really transform someones life by enabling them to communicate effectively and reassuring loved ones that everything is ok.
We created the first OwnFone four years ago and the fully customisable, incredibly easy to use voice only mobile phone was an instant hit!
We managed to provide over 10,000 people with a really simple way to communicate with their loved ones - everyone loved it!

So we decided to think about how we could make it even better.  We wanted to keep the really flexible design, it had to be super easy to use just like before, but we wanted to add lots of background features that would significantly enhance its value to you and your family.

Features like GPS tracking to alert you when things aren't right, making it waterproof to protect against unexpected accidents and the ability to send information on the devices current status.  We also wanted to make it as future proof as currently possible, so we are adding 3G & 4G, Bluetooth, Wi-Fi and GPS!  We will have a built in service which prevents anyone other than pre-approved callers from the calling - no more cold callers!!!
All this extra functionality means that we can start to think about adding medical sensors in the future, home sensors where someone might not necessarily have home broadband and much much more!
To summarise, the OwnFone is the simplest, but most effective way of enabling anyone to communicate!
So we are pleased to present the all new OwnFone!  This new device will feature everything that you loved in the old device, with the added benefits listed above.

You will be able to make and receive calls in an ultra easy one touch way, via 2G, 3G & 4G.  Find out where the device is via the ultra easy iOS & Android app, but also via a normal PC or Mac browser.  All of this is powered by the market leading Anywhere Sim.  In the future, the device will also be able to interact with Bluetooth devices, either wearable devices, or even in home monitors like smoke alarms or connected thermostats.
We want to make this device the main connectivity platform in your loved ones home, especially where there is no existing broadband.
What We Need & What You Get!
To enable us to produce the new OwnFone, we have a target of £250,000.  This will enable us to deliver the all-new OwnFone along with the new Android & iOS apps.
There is a portion of the funding required for the certification of the device.
We need to finalise the internal device architecture.
Finish the new device tooling and confirm final specification of the apps.
Carry out all the necessary testing and confirm final design.
We have to hit our financial target to get started, so we have created some attractively priced perks to encourage you to help us on our way!
There are five perks and they range from 25% off to 15% off.
They all include everything you will need for 12 months, including the industry leading multi network Anywhere Sim!

The new OwnFone removes any barriers to adopting mobile technology by removing all the complexity normally associated with mobile phones.  Our devices are transforming how people communicate already, but with the new device we can start to develop all kinds of new ways of caring for our loved ones and helping to maintain their independence for as long as possible.

We already have a tried and tested external design for the OwnFone, so the main challenge for us is fitting the extra functionality inside the existing device housing.  We are confident we can, but it may be necessary to make the device slightly thicker.  We will also be keeping a very close eye on the battery performance to make sure the device maintains its attractive lifespan.
Other than that, we are absolutely confident we can deliver the finished product within the target!

We understand that not everyone has a requirement for the new device, but almost everyone knows someone who could really benefit from it.  We want to spread the word as far and wide as possible, this device can really transform someones life by enabling them to communicate effectively and reassuring loved ones that everything is ok.

What is Purebox?

Purebox is the first UV box with wireless charger for phone, watches and airpods, at the same time. It uses the principle of ultraviolet, to clean any object entirely.
Purebox is not only for mobile phones, watches and airpods, it is also very suitable for Bluetooth headphones, toothbrushes, watches, toys, pacifiers, glasses, keys, jewelry and any other small objects

 

Why is Purebox so great?

 

Clean all your gadgets in 3 minutes
Short press the cleaning button, the blue breathing light is on : start cleaning. After 3 minutes, the blue light flashes for 5 seconds and then turn off : cleaning is complete.
The UV lamp will be automatically shut off if you open the cover during its working. It will protect your eyes and health from UVC light.

 

Wireless charging for all your devices
Charge any device with the wireless charging pad. Wireless Charging Output: 10W(max). Wireless Charging Conversion rate: 72%

 

Apple Watch charger dock
Charge your Apple Watch with the charger dock include in the box. Watch Output: 5W

 

Apple AirPods charger dock
Charge your Airpods with the lightening charger dock include in the box. Note that you can use it also for Apple products without wireless charging feature like iPods, iPhones, etc. Lightening Output: 5W  

 

Where can you use your Purebox? 

At work

At home

In your bedroom

In your bathroom

In the kitchen

 

Prototyping

We took time to study, measure, calculate the dimensions. Because each device is different we had to work on the perfect fit for the maximum of devices.  The hardest part was to find a solution to make the cleaning process work in 5 minutes. We’ve finally found the right process and are happy to share with you some souvenirs from the prototyping process.

 

 

Technical specifications

Size: 220*220*55mm
Input Power: 5V/2A
column2:
9V/2A
Headphone Output: 5W
Watch Output: 5W
UV Output: 2W
Wireless Charging Output: 10W(max)
Wireless Charging Conversion rate: 72%
Rated Frequency: 110-205kHz
Transmission distance: ≤6MM
Output Current: 9V 1.0~1.5A
Transmit Power: 10W 5W 2W
Transmission Distance: 10mm
Size: 210*210*70mm

 

 

What does our timeline looks like?

We don't anticipate any issues with this timeline. However, if anything unexpected happens, we promise to keep you informed, both during and after the campaign.

At the beginning, we conducted research on different battery packs in the market and discovered that most of them used a Li-ion cell which was thick and bulky. Worse still, it may be explosive after a long time of use at a high temperature. To build a thinner and safer battery pack, we decided to use a Li-Polymer cell, which is slim in size and non-explosive, in MaxJuice. Li-ion contains liquid-form solvents in the cell, which may cause danger. In contrast, all parts in the Li-polymer cell are in solid form. Prototypes of the Li-polymer battery pack were built in order to confirm the slim outlook.

Moreover, high-technology devices, including smartphones and tablets, are increasingly important in our daily lives, making it essential to keep them running all the time. Hence we aim at maximizing the battery capacity while balancing the size and weight of the battery pack.
And that's why you need MaxJuice, a slim yet ultra-high capacity battery pack.
• Dimension : 154 x 74 x 24 mm / 6.1 x 2.9 x 0.95 inch
• Simultaneously can charge two devices with the USB ports

column2: >Custom LCD to show remaining capacity and Charging Status
>Connect MaxJuice to any USB power-in device (e.g. cell phone) with a USB cable to one of the USB Connectors
>1A and 2.1A USB output can be used simultaneously
>Press the side button anytime to check the remaining capacity at LCD screen

column1: MaxJuice has a custom made LCD screen. Press the side button of the MaxJuice to turn it on.
It will show the remaining capacity of MaxJuice as well as the usage of the power output ports.
When Both Output Ports are in Use
Advantages of Li-Polymer Batteries VS Li-ion Batteries

MaxJuice uses Lithium Polymer (Li-Po) batteries. They have several advantages over Lithium ion batteries (Li-ion or commonly known as 18650 Li-ion batteries), which are commonly used in other battery packs. Below are the advantages of Li-Po batteries:
• Larger capacity to size ratio, which means having more capacity in the same size of batteries.
• Most importantly, safer to use. It has gelled electrolytes (while Li-ion batteries have liquid electrolytes). This gives more resistance to overcharging, overheating or short circuit.
Flat USB Charging Cables (to Micro USB) with a wide range of beautiful colors and lengths.
Add to get one colorful USB charging cable in the color of your own choice!
• Conducted research on similar products in the market
• Conduct QC of products before they leave factory
• Pack products into small parcels for each backer

Larger capacity to size ratio, which means having more capacity in the same size of batteries.
Most importantly, safer to use. It has gelled electrolytes (while Li-ion batteries have liquid electrolytes). This gives more resistance to overcharging, overheating or short circuit.
Flat USB Charging Cables (to Micro USB) with a wide range of beautiful colors and lengths.
Add to get one colorful USB charging cable in the color of your own choice!
Conducted research on similar products in the market
Conduct QC of products before they leave factory
Pack products into small parcels for each backer

BikeWatch is a new type bicycle security device. It is fixable under the bike seat and comes together with a cable lock and rear LED light. It’s built in waterproof, die-cast aluminum casing which gives extra protection against breaking off. The alarm is built not only to give a similar protection level as heavy chain locks do, but also to be easy to use and look good.

I and my friends are active cyclists who use bicycle every day to get from home to work or school. We have faced the same problem that many other cyclists have - light bicycle locks don’t guarantee the necessary safety, but large chains and U locks are too heavy and impractical to carry them with you every day. So it all ended for me not using locks at all, because I hate to carry heavy stuff in my backpack or keep the lock on my bike while riding.

After one of my bikes got stolen I started to search for alternatives and decided to stay with an alarm, because GPS solutions are expensive, easy to detect and I still need to carry a lock around. I ordered two different alarms, but upon receiving them I saw that they are ugly as hell and easy to break. I showed them to my friend who is an engineer and he said that he could make a better and safer alarm. And here you can see to what we have come after 5 months, 4 prototypes, long hours with designers and hard work.

The alarm function in BikeWatch device can be activated with iButton key. Just by pushing on iBotton reader with the key you can activate or deactivate the alarm. When the alarm is activated, it has three alert levels.

• At the first level, when the alert feels vibration, it beeps for once and goes in the waiting mode for 10 seconds. If there is no movement during these 10 seconds, it goes back in the vibration waiting mode.
• If there is another movement during the 10 second waiting mode, it goes into the second alert level and gives out a 3 second long warning sound.

• If there is the third movement during the waiting mode, it goes into the third alert mode and gives a 105 dB loud noise for as long as there is a movement and for 30 more seconds after the movement stops.

When the cable is plugged in the alarm, it is automatically fixed by the electronic lock. It is possible to unplug it only when the alarm is not activated, by pushing on and holding iButton reader for 3 seconds just with your finger, and the alarm releases the cable and you can pull it out. When the alarm is activated you cannot pull out the cable and if it is cut, then the alarm goes off at the maximum level for 10 minutes and then stays at the 3rd alert level until it is deactivated.
There are two BikeWatch models with cable:
<li>with regular 3.3 feet (~1m) long and 0.2 inches (~5mm) wide cable
<li>with pull-in 6 feet (1.8 m) long and 0.06 inches (~1.5 mm) wide cable

The device also has special design rear LED lights with optic fiber cables for better visibility. Lights can be turned on and switched between modes by shortly pushing on iButton reader with a finger.

Installation is fast and easy. Insert 9v battery, fix the device under your seat (fits poles from 27.2mm till 31.6mm) with 4 screws (screwdriver included) and you are ready to go. Inside, in front of each screw there is a sensor, and if someone tries to take off the device while the alarm is active, it goes off at full volume.
• Dimensions: length - 3,9 inches (100mm), width 3,54 inches - (90mm), height 1,57 inches (40mm)
• Weight: approx. 0.8 lb (360g) (version with pull in cable)
• Light source / brightness: High output LED / 50 000 mcd
• Battery life: 24 hours on maximum brightness, on blinking mode about 350 hours (depending on LED light usage)

Only for Indiegogo backers we offer an exclusive edition with green, blue and orange colors. All our products are anodized, but Indiegogo Exclusives have special colors and ID numbers from 1 – 299 and you won’t get these colors in retail.

We have developed a working prototype which is really close to the manufacturing version and if there are any changes to come, we will make them only for better. Still there are some small manufacturing and other challenges we will need to overcome to get this product to you.

As we have managed to build a team of professionals who have designed and developed several products for manufacturing companies, we are able to predict and overcome any obstacles or challenges which naturally will happen during the product’s life cycle.

One of the largest risks why there might be delay with shipping is that sometimes component suppliers are late with their shipping dates. We have developed a trusted supplier network from whom we have bought components for prototypes, so we hope that there won’t be any problems.

A lot of hardware manufacturing companies produce their products overseas and risk with quality. We want to have full control over the manufacturing process, so we will be doing assembling and testing ourselves. We have been testing all components for months to find the best for our alarm. In this way we can provide the highest quality to our product.
Thank you for reading and support. Don't forget to tell your friends about this amazing project and help us to reach our goal!
Do I need to bring a separate lock for the wheels?

Depends on which BikeWatch device you are using. If you’re using only the „BikeWatch” alarm, then a separate lock would be recommended, but if you are using „BikeWatch with regular cable” then lock for front wheel is recommended. If you have BikeWatch with pull-in cable then you don’t need a separate lock because cable is 6 feet long and goes through both wheels.
How tough is the cable? Can I snip it in 10 seconds or less?

Cable can be cut with 3 feet long cutters but then the alarm will go off on maximum volume. Cables’ main function is not to allow thieve to just grab your bike while you run in a coffee shop or the mall.
If the thief loosened the fixing bolts at top and bottom of the seat post he /she would be away with the rest.
You can change fixing bolt for special screw which will be included in every BikeWatch box.

column1: Little Sim Peeps is a game about raising and caring for your ""peeps"" as they make decisions, get into mischief, interact with their environment, each other, and have adventures.
Who I Am

Videogames are my one true passion.  I knew from the moment I pressed my first button, to move my first character, that they would be a big part of my life.  I've been developing videogames as a hobby for many years (10+), and now finally feel I have the skills I need to take on this unique idea.

Right now I work making iPhone apps for a company, after completing my Bachelor of Information Technology.  When I get home after working full-time hours, I work on my videogames hoping that one day I can become an independant videogame developer.  Unfortunately I've found out that is hardly an ideal situation to be in.
Helping to fund Little Sim Peeps will give me the time and funds I need to make a great indie game and get it out there for people to enjoy.
All funds will go towards development of the game, and keeping myself alive and homed during that development time.

I have most of the basic equipment I need to develop Little Sim Peeps, I am used to working on a low budget keeping costs down wherever possible.  Having funds will allow me to invest in tools to speed up development and make the game better as a whole.
The perks available to backers are only available during the campaign.
Note:  This is a fixed campaign, the funds will not go through unless the goal is met.
About the Game

In order for your peeps to survive you must help them obtain food. Keep them fed, but don't overfeed them! A starving peep, or an overweight peep will have low immunity to sickness. 
- Use fires and other objects to keep your peeps warm in the cold rain and snow, or keep them cool in the searing heat. 
- Keep your peep happy by providing it with toys and good food. Don't let the food sit around for hours on end, or it could go green and have a chance to cause sickness in your peeps! 

- Peeps continue to grow among other things while you are not playing the game. 
- Different personality peeps will react differently in different situations. 
- Peeps can be in states such as Happy, Sad, Angry, Confused, Disoriented, Love, Surprised, Panic, Hungry, Sick, and Dying.

Depending on your preference, in the beginning you will be provided with some structures to help house your peeps, store food and objects, as well as protect them from other creatures. Or house objects to help peeps train to defend themselves. (If you do not train your peeps, the game will recognize that you are not interested in combat elements and you may continue to play passively.) 
- Build your own structures block by block. 
- Fill your structures with objects for your peeps to interact with.
Life can be tough for peeps

Random events will occur to your peeps environment, usually as a challenge to overcome. (Depending on your style of play will trigger certain events. eg: If your peeps are not trained to defend themselves making it impossible for your peeps to overcome the event, the events that require fighting peeps should not occur.) 
- Meteor Showers 
- Earthquakes 
- Comet 
- Wild Monster Raid 
- Alien Invasion 
- Zombie outbreak, etc
Trade or give peeps to your friends! Feeling generous? Want to mix and match some different types of peeps? Share your peeps with the world.
Can't Contribute but Want to Help?  Or Want to Help More?
Help by sharing, Facebook, Twitter, Google Plus, and Steam Greenlight!
Sharing the campaign and getting it out there is a huge help!  Everyone can use help from a friend, right?
Stretch Goals:
The game will be available on Mac, Linux, iOS, and Android.
More content in the form of objects for your peeps to interact with.
More content in the form of events that can happen while playing.

0,"

Intelligent power management for Raspberry Pi

RPi is usually powered by wall power supply adapter with +5VDC/1A output. Once power cord is plugged in, RPi starts booting and after while Linux desktop appears. Once 'System Shutdown' signal from Linux is sent shutdown routine will be activated and computer goes into stand-by mode after some time. Little power is still consumed in stand-by mode. Keyboard and/or mouse and monitor must be connected to the RPi to properly handle shutdown. To boot RPi again, power must be toggled OFF-ON manually. Therefore manual power switch must be installed or 'adapter plug/unplug' must be performed to boot system again. And this is small flaw in current RPi configuration....

Linux as almost all others operation systems does not like hot unplug of power supply. During this event loss of data or data corruption may occur. Thus is strongly recommended to perform proper Boot/Shutdown sequence via Linux 'System shutdown' command. This task is easy once monitor, keyboard and/or mouse are present. But, if RPi is used as embedded computer, this operation become very difficult.

Problem can be easily solved by using miniature RPi ATX power supply snap-in board. This simple piece of hardware is equipped with microcontroller, solid state overcurrent protected switch, LED indicators and push button. Original Mini USB power cable is connected to ATX-PS board instead of RPi itself. When push button is pressed for time period longer than 2s, RPi will power-up and boot into Linux environment. If user decides to shutdown RPi, push button needs to be pressed for 2s again. LED indicator starts toggle and 'System Shutdown' signal will be send to Linux. After RPi goes to Stand-by mode, power supply is disconnected and RPi board is completely power off. Frozen RPi can be restarted by pressing push button longer than 5s.

This 'One button' solution has obvious benefits once RPi is used as embedded computer or even if user is lazy to issue Shutdown command via mouse or keyboard. There is also additional 2 pin connector for external +5VDC power supply connection. Why? Because I am not big fan of USB-Micro connectors and want to have option for connection of another power source as well.

ATX-PS is snap-in and GO! board with 26way connector on one side and fixing hole 3.2mm on other side. One M3 bolt and 10mm spacer are holding board in place. There is possibility to add (solder) additional 26way connector with 1:1 connection in case user wants to preserve all extension GPIO pins for his own application. There is only one restriction in this setup. Pin GPIO4 – P7 is used for system shutdown and can not be used by other user applications. See pictures Gallery on top of this page.

column2: What We Do

column1: We are bunch of electronics enthusiast, engineers and hobbyist who likes everyday chalenges and love to solve problems. We are trying to promote control electronics to mases and support tallented kids with their projects.

Based in Singapore we have access to Hi-tech technology and manufacturing facilities. Therefore there is no problem to arrange mass production of useful devices and distribute it worldwide. We hope, RPi-ATX-PS will be one of them.
What We Need
There has been few attempts to develop power management board for Raspberry Pi. All of them are FIY (finish it yourself) devices and they are not so user friendly.

Therefore we have developed our own RPi-ATX-PS board for our own use. But we got some additional demand from other folks which find this device usefull. There exist reasonable assumption, that more people worldwide will like our solution and we want to give a shot.

To manufacture this little board as cheap as possible, larger quantity must be ordered. According to our calculation, $2500 is minimum amount to send order to manufacturer, set up machines, manufacture one batch and pay all logistic fee and commissioning time. And this is what we need money for...
If you will back up this project three messages from you will be send out:
based on your feedback, we will get idea for future manufacturing...
What You Get
For every $15 of pledge you will get one fully assembled, tested and ready to use ATX-PS as per small top picture
• If your pledge will cover 1 device you have to add 5$ to cover delivery charge worldwide     total pledge $15 + $5 = $20
• If your pledge will cover 2 devices you have to add 5$ to cover delivery charge worldwide  total pledge 2x$15 + $5 = $35
• If your pledge will cover 3 or more devices you will get 3 or more devices $15 each with free delivery worldwide.
If total amount funded will exceed $5000 there will be  free delivery charge world wide for everybody who will order more than one piece of ATP-PS !

Final PCB will contain branded components and will be gold plated. PCB on picture is tin plated. PCB color will be Black or Green and decision about  what color will be used will be made by You on our forum later on.
• overcurrent protection 1.5A (very handy if something goes wrong with RPi or periphery)

Simple script issuing command ‘Shutdown –h now’ is monitoring ATX-PS board and once power off request from board is given, command will be executed. Short script uses native Linux commands and standard memory access. No Python interpreter or additional libraries like WiringPI, BCM2835 or others are needed. Script and detailed instructions how to install it will be available on website...
Thank you for your consideration...
